items.description:
Address details associated with the customer and his role in a business transaction.

A structured reference to a physical location for a business party.

BsnPtyCd.description:
Business party code.

The unique identifier of a business party.

items.description:
Business Party relationship

The parent BP is in the role From and the child BP is in the role To of the relationship.

BsnPtyRelTyCd.description:
Business party relationship type code.

The unque identifier of a Business party relationship type.

Cmt.description:
Comment

Further comments for the relationship.

FromRlTyCd.description: From business party role type code.

ToRlTyCd.description: To business party role type code.

items.description:
Contact details.

Contact details associated with the Business Party and his role in a business transaction.

The function or title of a person who represents a Business party in a relationship with US.
Communication device number: The number (or e-mail address) for the communication type used by this customer. Provides the different communication methods given by the customer.
Data element group.
Documents and Images (Attachments)
Data element group for additional data elements.

DocId.description:
Shipment documentation identifier

The  unique identifier for a shipment document. For the contract with the customer, ie. the waybill, the identifier is the waybill number.

DocSbTyCd.description:
Document sub type code

Identifies uniquely a document sub type.

The authoritative source of the document sub type reference data is Company SOP.

DocTyCd.description:
Document type code

Identifies uniquely a document type., e.g.Visa, export licence, import licence, SGS certificate, commercial invoice, certificate of origin.

The authoritative source of the document type reference data is Company SOP.

items.description: Data element group for additional data elements.

EnCdTy.description: Image.Image encoding type:Format of image file.  List of allowable values maintained by CPI CRB. Three-letter code should follow PC standards for file name extensions. Currently allowed: TIF  TIFF file

Img.description:
Rendered image out of the input data.

In base64Binary format.

MimeTy.description: Image mime type:Specifies MIME type of Image Encoding List of allowable values maintained by CPI CRB. Currently allowed: image/tiff

Size.description: Image size:Image size in bytes.  This attribute can be use for example for checking of data completness.

Nm.description: Document name

ElgblExCrtfInd.description:
Eligible exporter certification indicator

Eligible party certification indicator. Certification by the government agency that the exporter is an eligible party to export the product. 

In US, this certification is required only when an exemption is claimed.

ExmtNo.description:
Exemption number

The exemption number is the specific citation that exempts the shipment from the requirements for a license or other written authorization from government agency.

items.description:
Business Party HHS chapter group.

List of the commodity chapter groups which the Business Party can operate with, such as ship, or receive.

Business Party Industry

The Industries as specfied for the Business Party.

Business Party Name

The name of the business party.
It can be the organization name or Individual full name. 
The attribute is de-normalized from the Organization or Individual name.
Sales Opportunity identified for the Business Party

Opportunity statuses.

Business party can have one or more statuses of a status type at a moment.

Only one status of one type is allowed for a Business party at a moment.

ProdCd.description: Commodity product code assigned by the government agency.

ProdNm.description: Commodity product name assigned by the government agency.

items.description: Government Agency Line item quantity.

Business Party registration

An official identification issued by a regulatory body to a business party.

Business Party type code: "A code that uniquely identifies a Business party role.
VALUES are:
BC=Barcode
BT=Bill TO
BY=Buyer
DF=Destination Facility
DH=DDI Shipper
DP=DDI Payer
DR=DDI Receiver
DS=Dispatch
DL=Delivery
EP=Exporter
FR=Freight Customer
IN=Indivisible trans
IP=Importer
IQ=Inquirer
LP=Logistic Service Supplier
LS=Logistic Supplier Provider
MR=Message Receiver Party
MS=Message Sender Party
NF=Non Freight Customer
OB=Origin Barcode
OF=Origin Facility
OP=Operational
PK=PACKAGE KEY
PU=Pick-up
PY=Payer
RQ=Requestor
RT=RETURN TO
RV=Receiver
SP=Shipper
SU=Supplier
TC=Technical
TH=Third party
BR - Broker
DC - Declarant

Business Party Sub Industry

The Sub Industries as specfied for the Business Party.

Business PartyAddress score

The Business PartyAddress scores of a Score type.

Business party statuses.

Business party can have one or more statuses of a status type at a moment.

Only one status of one type is allowed for a Business party at a moment.

Business Party Address Contact Association

The associated BPAC with this BPAC with defined association type.

BPACntId.description:
Business Party Address Contact Identifier

The globally unique identification of Business Party Address and Contact relationship.

GUID supported.

items.description:
Business PartyAddress Contact score

The score of the unique relationship between Business Party Address and Contact.

Business Party Address Contact status

The status of the unique relationship between Business Party Address and Contact.

ByRolCd.description: Buying role code: "The role that a contact has in procurement, e.g. process approver, decision maker, influencer, user."

CntId.description:
Contact business party role identifier.

Uniquelly identifies Business Party role in one Business party relationship.

CntTy.description:
Contact type

Specific type needs to be defined for a Contact.
e.g. Main

items.description: Communication device number: The number (or e-mail address) for the communication type used by this customer. Provides the different communication methods given by the customer.
Data element group.

ExpcShprInd.description: Contact experience shipper indicator: Indicates whether a contact is an experienced shipper. Requirement added form Service Star.

ExpsCdNo.description: Contact expense code number: Requirement from Service Star. Apparently used as a reference to the cost centre used by the Customer.

Indv.description: Characteristics of a single person as the contact.

MlStpInd.description: Contact mail stop indicator: An indicator specifying that a contact should not be included in any mailing.

NvrEmInd.description: Contact never e-mail indicator: A flag indicating that a contact has not authorised Company to send e-mail.

PrfCntMth.description:
Contact preferred contact method: "The preferred contact method of a contact, e.g. e-mail, phone, fax.
EML=E-mail
TEL=Phone
FAX=Fax
MOB=Mobile"

PrfLngCd.description:
Contact preferred Language Code

Identifies the preferred language for contacting the Contact.

Code to uniquely identify a language.

ISO 639-2 Code

items.description: Shipment customer contact score.

IndvRlTy.description:
Individual role type

Indicates that the role of  the Individual for the Position.

e.g.: Owner

Nm.description: Position name

items.description: Organization Unit

PosId.description:
Position Identifier

The unique ientifier of the position within the origanization.

items.description: Position in Sales Terriotry

PosRlTy.description:
Position role type

Indicates the role of the Position for the Territory

e.g. Primary, Secondary

TrtRlTy.description:
Territory role type

Indicates that the role of  the Territory for the Position.

e.g.: Primary

PosRlTy.description:
Position role type

Indicates the role of the Position for the Individual.

e.g. Primary, Secondary

PosTy.description:
Position Type

The Position Type drives workflows in COMET; e.g. short or long Opportunity pipeline, Activity record defaults, Next Contact Date (cust), Expected Close Date (opty).
The Position Type is directly linked to the Position of a user not the user itself.
The Position Type is used in reporting to distinguish the role a user has within the Company Express organization.
Positions can not be deleted from COMET but you can provide an end-date instead

SalChnNm.description:
Sales channel Name

Identifies uniquely a sales channel, such as For Qualification, Global Customer, etc.

AccTyCd.description:
Account type (code)

Account type as defined for the particular Shipment.
The Account type is defaulted from the Customer Account account type, and can be changed during the Shipment validation process.
The Payer Account type is used in Billing.

items.description:
Customer registration

An official identification issued by a regulatory body to a business party.

Data element.

Provides a flexible tool for a capture of specific data elements and their values.

Data element group.

Optional element allowing of data element groups within data elements groups.

This construct supports capture of complex specific information structures.

Alt.description: Geo position altitude: "The vertical distance of a level, a point or an object considered as a point, measured from mean sea level."

AvlDtm.description: Event available datetime: The time at which the data is available (and is the time that is returned by GQS).

CCrpLglEntCd.description: Captured corporate legal entity code: "A unique identifier of a billing entity, also called a Company company code or CREST code."

CIndvId.description:
Event captured user identifier identifier: 

The unique identifier of an individual.

CMthCd.description:
Event capture method code: "A code that uniquely identifies a capturing method, e.g.
SCA=Scan
KEY=Keyed
AUT=Automated
RTF=RF-tag."

COpsFncId.description:
Captured operation function identifier.

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that captured the event. This identifier can be an identifier of a Route, Movement, facility etc.

CUsrNm.description:
Event captured user name.

The application user name of the person which identified or is source of the event.

CUsrNmTy.description:
Event captured user name type.

The type of the user identifier provided in the Application user name/identifier. Such as: LDAP, email address

items.description:
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Dtm.description:
Event datetime: 

The timestamp of the occurrence of the event and when it was captured.

Lat.description:
Geo position latitude: "Also called the Parallel. The distance north or south of the equator of a point on the earth s surface. This distance is measured in degrees, minutes, and seconds. Lines (parallels) of latitude circle the earth horizontally and are parallel to one another. One minute of latitude equals one nautical mile.
(south latitudes are negative)"

Lgtd.description:
Geo position longitude: "Also called the meridian.
The distance east OR west OF the prime meridian OF a point ON the earth s surface. Longitude IS measured IN degrees, minutes AND seconds. Lines (meridians) OF longitude CREATE a geographic grid around the world AND are NOT PARALLEL, but rather converge AT the poles.
(West longitude IS depicted BY negative VALUES.)"

RCd.description:
Event reason code: 

A code to uniquely identify an event reason.

RecDtm.description:
Event recording datetime: 

Data Entry Timestamp (Insertion Timestamp).

The data ENTRY TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event details BECOME available TO
a business application ON an ON-line computer SYSTEM. This could be the TIME that CHECKPOINT
details were entered through the keyboard USING an ON-line device, OR the TIME that information
FROM an OFF-line device such AS a courier scanner was downloaded AND the data uploaded TO the
backend systems."

RecIndvId.description:
Event recording user name: 

The unique identifier of an individual.

RecOpsFncId.description:
Recording operation function identifier: 

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that recorded the event. This identifier can be an identifier of a Route, Movement, facility etc.

RecUsrNm.description:
Event recording user name.

The application user name that uniquely identify a user within a system or set of systems.

e.g. LDAP USER ID

RecUsrNmTy.description:
Event recorded user name type.

The type of the user identifier provided in the Application user name/identifier. Such as: LDAP, email address

Rmk.description:
Event remark: 

Additional remarks provided as a reason for the event.

For Handling unit, Shipment or Piece: Event standard remark as defined in Checkpoint Business Guide.

SDtm.description:
Event send datetime: 

Event Issue Timestamp (Generation Timestamp)

The event issue TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event information IS sent FROM
the business application that records it TO the appropriate databases. IN most cases this will be the
TIME that the message IS passed FROM the business application TO the LOCAL communications
infrastructure."

ScnSw.description: Event scanner software: The name of the software used by the scanning device.

Event type code: 
The code uniquely identifying a valid event type.

Lat.description:
Geo position latitude: "Also called the Parallel. The distance north or south of the equator of a point on the earth s surface. This distance is measured in degrees, minutes, and seconds. Lines (parallels) of latitude circle the earth horizontally and are parallel to one another. One minute of latitude equals one nautical mile.
(south latitudes are negative)"

Lgtd.description:
Geo position longitude: "Also called the meridian.
The distance east OR west OF the prime meridian OF a point ON the earth s surface. Longitude IS measured IN degrees, minutes AND seconds. Lines (meridians) OF longitude CREATE a geographic grid around the world AND are NOT PARALLEL, but rather converge AT the poles.
(West longitude IS depicted BY negative VALUES.)"

Event reason code: 

A code to uniquely identify an event reason.

RecDtm.description:
Event recording datetime: 

Data Entry Timestamp (Insertion Timestamp).

The data ENTRY TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event details BECOME available TO
a business application ON an ON-line computer SYSTEM. This could be the TIME that CHECKPOINT
details were entered through the keyboard USING an ON-line device, OR the TIME that information
FROM an OFF-line device such AS a courier scanner was downloaded AND the data uploaded TO the
backend systems."

Event type code:

BsnDomainId.description:
Business domain identifier.

The unque identifier of a Business domain within a Corporate division.

The Handling instruction is intended for this Business domain.

CatCd.description:
Coded value for a handling instruction category.
F	Informative
P	Imperative
T	Interrogative

Conf.description:
Confidentiality:
The Corporate Information Security Standard (CISS) defines that all organization information stored and distributed aither internally or externally must be clssified according its confidentiality level into one of four classes:
0 - Unclassified
1 - For Internal Use
2 - Restricted
3 - Confidential

Confidentiality level is used as indicator how a HI needs to be processed by human and systems.

3 - Confidential: This level requires encryption of the HI Description attribute.

CrDtm.description: The date and time when the handling instruction was created.

CreByBsnPtyRolTyCd.description: Business party role type code which created the Handlign Instruction.

items.description:
Handling Instruction data element group.

Additional information can be provided for a Handling instruction.

A Handling instruction type or category can require additional or complementary information to be captured togehter with its Description.
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Description: "Details to be provided for a specific handling instruction type.

Complementary information TO coded value AND description OF Handling instruction TYPE code."

EffDt.description: Effective date: The date from when the handling instruction becomes active.

ExpDt.description: Expiry date: The date when the handling instuction is expired and is no longer active.

GI.description:
General information

The complex type is optional and may be required by use cases such as versioning or correlation.

HIId.description: Unique identifier of a handling instruction.

items.description: A Handling instruction can be associated with another handling instruction.

AscHIId.description: Unique identifier of the associated handling instruction.

AscTy.description:
Defines the type of association between HI and Associated HI.

TRG - Triggering
CLS - Closing

If the association type is set to TRG, then Associated HI is triggered creation of HI.

GI.description:
General information

The complex type is optional and may be required by use cases such as versioning or correlation.

items.description: Handling instruction event. The list of events capture progress, history and status update of the handling instruction.

Pri.description: Priority: "Defines in which priority the handling instruction should be processed:· 10 Low· 50 Medium· 70 HighThe values are 0 to 100. The reserved valuefor Low is 10, for Medium is 50, and for High is 70. Other priorities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 100."

ProcLvl.description:
Process level hierarchy.
Identifies uniquely a specific business process where the HI applies.

The Handling instruction can be applicable to a certain business process of a level in the hierarchy.

Sev.description: Severity: "Defines the severity of the handling instruction:The predefined severity levels, in order ofincreasing severity, are as follows:· 0 Unknown· 10 Information MUST be used for cases when the event contains only general information and is not reporting an error.· 20 Harmless MUST be used for cases in which the error event has no effect on the normal operation of theresource.· 30 Warning MUST be used when it is appropriate to let the user decide if an action is needed in response to the event.· 40 Minor MUST be used to indicate that action is needed, but the situation is not serious at this time.· 50 Critical MUST be used to indicate that an immediate action is needed and the scope is broad (perhaps an imminent outage to a critical resource will result).· 60 Fatal MUST be used to indicate that an error occurred, but it is too late to take remedial action.The associated values are 0 to 70. The reserved values start at 0 for Unknown andincrease by increments of 10 to 60 for Fatal. Other severities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 70. This is an OPTIONAL property."

St.description:
Status: "Status of the handling instruction to be updated during its life cycle.

CRE - Created
REC - Received
APP - Approved
ACC - Accepted
DEC - Declined
PRO - Processed
CLS - Closed"

SysEnvCd.description: System Environment Code: "The system Environment Code is used to identify whether this particular record is being created as a result of a ¿test¿ or as ¿production¿ level integration. Often times as new systems are brought online, testing must be performed in a production environment in order to ensure complete integration. This attribute allows the integrator to flag test messages as such. The systemEnvironmentCode attribute is an optional attribut.The data will be processed as production if the attribute is not specified. Allowed values: PROD - Production, TEST - Test"

TriggerTyCd.description:
Trigger type code

The Handling instruction creation was triggered by this trigger type.

TyCd.description: Handling instruction type code:

items.description: Handling unit monetary amount.

CFlag.description:
Complete Handling unit flag - denormalized.

The generated flag out of the Handling unit actual profile.

This attribute is redundant to the profile and needs to be updated when ever the profile changes.

items.description: Data element group.

Handling unit dangerous goods content.

This is information aggregated from Piece content captured in Shipment document line.

DstSrvaCd.description: Handling unit destination service area code.

Dtm.description:
De-containerization datetime.

The datetime when the HU was removed from the parent HU.

items.description: Information about events.

Handling unit flag - normalized.

The generated flag out of the Handling unit actual profile.

This attribute is redundant to the profile and needs to be updated when ever the profile changes.
Handling unit handling instruction.
Handling unit in Document

TyCd.description: Document type code

HUTyCd.description:
Handling unit type code

A code to indicate the type of device that can be used to transport shipments.
E.g.: 
C=Container
U=Uld

items.description:
Handling unit in Handling unit.

Contains information about the highest level child Handling unit attached to the parent Handling Unit.

LdDevRgsNo.description:
Handling unit load device registration number

The formal and physical identifier of any receptacle that is used to enclose the contents of a Handling unit.

LdDevRgsNoQf.description:
Handling unit load device registration number Qualifier

Code indicating whether a container is marked (letters and/or numbers) in accordance with ISO 6346 or some other system, to enable the correct validation routine to be operated 

Alias: Container Id Qualifier

items.description: Handling unit measures

NPcs.description:
Number of Pieces in the Handling Unit

The number of Pieces contained in the HU, including content of child HU's.

OnBrdInd.description:
Handling Unit on Board Indicator

Indicates whether the handling unit is required to be allocated on board. 

Required for road movement allocations only. N/A for air movement allocations.

OrgSrvaCd.description: Handling unit origin service area code.

items.description:
Piece in handling unit.

Contains information about which pieces are attached to a handling unit.

PdCntnCd.description:
Product content code: "A code uniquely to identify a product content.

E.g.: WPX"

PlltCntrCd.description:
Pallet contour code

Classification of the pallet contour.

Allowed and required for pallets only.

PlnPrfl.description:
Handling unit planned.
The planned profile used for initialization of the HU instance.

PosId.description:
Handling unit position identifier.

Explains the position in the Vehicle.

PosNo.description:
Handling unit position number.

Explains the position in the Vehicle.

PosstvAllcInd.description:
Handling unit positively allocated indicator.

Indicates whether the handling unit is positively containerized, i.e. has been physically scanned or not. With possible values:

P - Positive containerization of all shipments

N - Non positive containerization of shipments; shipments are reported containerized in a container without scanning each piece.

M - Mixed containerization; shipments are placed into a container without scanning (eg. ACS material in an ULD) and can be mixed with other shipments that may be scanned positively.

PrcngCrgInd.description:
Piercing Cargo Indicator

Indicates that there is anything sharp on a handling unit which can perforate another handling unit.

RgdPcsInd.description:
Rigid Pieces Indicator

Indicates that at least one Piece  in the HU is Rigid.

items.description:
Shipment in handling unit.

Contains information about which shipment are attached to a handling unit.
HU Special buildup information

Handling Unit statuses.

Handling unit can have one or more statuses of statu type at a moment.

Only one status of one type is allowed for a Handling Unit at a moment.

VolPcnt.description:
Handling unit volume percentage

A value expressing the estimate of the volume of material that is loaded in to a handling unit as a percentage of the handling unit's maximum volumetric capacity.

ArrDtm.description:
The actual movement arrival datetime.

The actual UTC date and time of arrival of the movement is derived from the Movement event timestamp.

The timestamp is derived from arrival event timestamp.

items.description:
Scheduled movement - Movement cutoff datetime.

The movement cutoff time is the date and time where operational processing must be completed for that movement This is for example the airline cutoff time where we must lodge shipments with them or miss the flight.  Analogous to the gate close time for a passenger flight.

The date time is expressed in UTC plus the departure facility local time zone offset.
Date is the same as scheduled departure date and should not be required to be entered by an user and taken from the scheduled departure date.

This is derived data element from Scheduled movement.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency

 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

The actual UTC date and time of departure of the movement is derived from the Movement event timestamp.

The timestamp is derived from departure event timestamp.

DstSrvaCd.description:
The actual Movement destination service area code.

This information is de-normalized from Movement Destination Facility Identifier and should be used only for minimalization of the informarion lookup by each process.

Movement estimated arrival datetime.

The estiamted UTC date and time of arrival of the movement to the destination.

The local time offset and Time Zone code is the Movement destiantion location  local offset and Time zone code.

If provided then it is estimated that the arrival to destianation will differ from the scheduled arrival datetime - schedule deviation

EstDptDtm.description:
Estimated movement departure datetime

The scheduled UTC date and time of departure of a movement.

The local time offset and Time Zone code is the Movement origin location  local offset and Time zone code.

MdOfTrns.description:
Mode of Transport: Identifies a Mode of transport.

The actual codes are defined in global reference data repository and should be aligned with the global standard.

The list should be aligned with international standard defined by UNECE:
1 - Maritime transport
2 - Rail transport
3 - Road transport
4 - Air transport
6 - Multimodal transport
7 - Fixed transport installation
8 - Inland water transport

e.g.:

Load Stand Identifier

Named or numbered location within Movement origin airport apron or facility truck yard for loading the Movement.

items.description: Movement sector (leg)

MdOfTrns.description:
Mode of Transport: Identifies a Mode of transport.

The actual codes are defined in global reference data repository and should be aligned with the global standard.

The list should be aligned with international standard defined by UNECE:
1 - Maritime transport
2 - Rail transport
3 - Road transport
4 - Air transport
6 - Multimodal transport
7 - Fixed transport installation
8 - Inland water transport

MvmtNtwTyCd.description:
Movement network type code

The code to differentiate between the networks the Movemet is operated by.

e.g.:
NET - dedicated network 
COM - commercial

NtwRtNo.description:
Network route number.

A unique number identifying a scheduled network route, which can combine many movements.

OrgFcCd.description:
Movement origin Facility code.

This information is de-normalized from Movement Origin Facility Identifier and should be used only for minimalization of the informarion lookup by each process.

OrgIATACd.description:
Movement origin IATA airport code.

Is populated with IATA airport code for air movements.

OrgSrvaCd.description:
Movement origin service area code.

This information is de-normalized from Movement Origin Facility Identifier and should be used only for minimalization of the informarion lookup by each process.

ProcTy.description:
The type of Shipment and goods processing performed by the Movement, such as:
 - border transit
 - Export
 - Import

items.description: Document line response status. The result of the document processing.

SchArrDtm.description:
Movement scheduled arrival datetime.

The scheduled UTC date and time of arrival of the movement to the destination.

The local time offset and Time Zone code is the Movement destiantion location  local offset and Time zone code.

SchDptDtm.description:
Scheduled movement departure datetime

The scheduled UTC date and time of departure of a movement.

The local time offset and Time Zone code is the Movement origin location  local offset and Time zone code.

SchMvmt.description:
Scheduled Movement
The recognised usage of a Vehicle on a specific time, to transport Shipments between two Facilities.

items.description:
Movement statuses.

Movement can have one or more statuses of a status type at a moment.

Only one status of one type is allowed for a Movement at a moment.

UnldStndId.description:
Unload Stand Identifier

Named or numbered location within Movement destination airport apron or facility truck yard for unloading the Movement.

Offload stand identifier is the synonym.

Veh.description: Details of vehicle assigned to the Movement

CstChrgTyCd.description:
A code to identify the rate of tax that will be levied.
e.g. VAT or duty, airport, excise, postal tax, carrier tax.

The code is defined by the regulatory body in the country and can be only interpreted within the scope of reference data defined by the regulatory body which levied the customs charge.

items.description: Customs charge type name

CstChrgTyCd.description:
A code to identify the rate of tax that will be levied.
e.g. VAT or duty, airport, excise, postal tax, carrier tax.

The code is defined by the regulatory body in the country and can be only interpreted within the scope of reference data defined by the regulatory body which levied the customs charge.

items.description: Customs charge type name

ActNPcs.description: Shipment actual number of pieces: "The total number of pieces belonging to a shipment, which have actually been picked up."

ActvDtm.description: Shipment DateTime - The date time of the first physical event against the shipment

items.description:
Associated child shipment identifier.

The option for the legacy and/or the target Shipment business key.

Both Shipment business keys will need to be provided during the migration period.

ShpId.description:
Shipment business key (legacy).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

Contains the child shipment business keys

ShpKey.description:
Shipment business key (target).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

Contains the child shipment business keys

AscPShpId.description:
Shipment business key (legacy).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

Contains the parent shipment business key

AscPShpKey.description:
Shipment business key (target).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

Contains the parent shipment business key

BkgRef.description: Booking Reference: A reference that is used to associate an order with a booking.

items.description: Shipment charge: Information about fees applied to a shipment for transportation.  A shipment charge can be a charge based on the weight of the shipment or a charge dependent on the customer tariff agreement.

A collection of information about a shipment transaction that helps serve the customer needs depending on the customer role type, e.g. shipper, receiver, etc.

Issue/Plan:
1) The address attributes need to be removed and referenced address entity should be used instead. The attributes are used by on a lot of interfaces using Company CF and migration path needs to be defined.

2) We have two customers: Shipment customer and Customer. The double definition should be resolved.

Customs charge

A code to identify the rate of tax that was levied.
e.g. VAT or duty, airport, excise, postal tax, carrier tax.

The charge code is defined by the regulatory body in the country and can be only interpreted within the scope of reference data defined by the regulatory body which levied the customs charge.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

DclInd.description:
Shipment declarable indicator.
Allowed values:
Y - Yes
N- No

Default value: N - No

Identifies whether or not a Shipment is Declarable to Inbound Customs for Import Clearance.

The indicator is derived from Shipment Product and de-normalized in this message for performance reasons.

DclNPcs.description: Shipment declared number of pieces: The number of pieces related to a shipment as declared by the customer.

items.description:
A list of Shipment delivery date time is required for a Shipment.

This entity allows for capture and maintenance of an unrestricted number of the Shipment delivery datetimes.

Shipment description: 

A brief description of the shipment with a specified type of description.

DstCtryCd.description: This is the destination of the shipment

DstFcCd.description: Destination facility code: A code to identify an addressed location where Company business functions are performed.

DstFcId.description:
Shipment destination facility identifier.

Identifies a Facility managing delivery of the Shipment.

EntrCstOfcCd.description:
Entry customs office code

To identify the regulatory office at which the goods leave or are intended to leave the customs territory of despatch.

items.description: Information about Shipment events.

ExitCstOfcCd.description:
Exit customs office code

To identify the regulatory office at which the goods enter the customs territory of destination.

ExmtRqCd.description:
Exemption request code

Code 42 - Simultaneous release for free circulation and home use of goods which  are the subject of a VAT-exempt supply to another Member State and, when  applicable, an excise duty suspension.
Code  45 - Release of goods for free circulation and home use for either VAT or excise duties and their placing under the tax warehouse procedure.
Code 63 - Re-importation with simultaneous release for free circulation and home
use of goods which are the subject of a VAT-exempt supply to another Member State

ExpCtryCd.description:
Exportation country code

Could be different from Ship from country code.

items.description:
Shipment free trade zone

Identification of Free Trade Zone (or Foreign Free Zone) were a
particular Shipment is to be or has been located.

FreeTrdZnStCd.description:
Free trade zone status code

A code to indicate that consignment into a free trade zone is a preliminary or final shipment.

GRN.description:
Global reference number

The target Booking business key.

GlProdSrvCd.description: Global Product and service code: Uniquely identifies a service, either a transportation service, feature, periodic charge or any other type of service that Company or its partners provide.

ImpCtryCd.description:
Importation country code

Could be different from Ship to country code.

IncTrmCd.description:
Incoterm code: "Defines uniquely an Incoterm. 

The international standard codes, not the Company Express specified Terms of Trade.

Company Express started to use the service codes instead.

IncTrmPlcCd.description:
Incoterm place code

Identifier of the point or port of departure, shipment or destination, as required under the applicable delivery term.

items.description: Local product and service code: Defines uniquely the local code used for the global, regional or local product or service.
Identifies how many units of each type of loading help have been used in the transportation of a shipment.
Shipment measures
With a shipment can be associated various monetary amounts, like value,  and charges. This entity provides an actual amount and type captured at and required by processing of a particular shipment.

OrgCtryCd.description: This is the origin of the shipment.

OrgFcId.description:
Shipment origin facility identifier.

Identifies Facility managing Shipment pickup.

items.description: A uniquely-identified part of a shipment that is packaged and handled separately.

Piece measurements as provided by customer in the cases where Piece
business object is not created yet and Piece identifier is not
assigned.

Is used to calculate the Shipper Dim Weight which is used by Billing
where Company has not reweighed pieces. Also used to validate variance
between Shipper declared Volumetric and Company Validated Volumetric.

PdCntnCd.description:
Product content code: "A code uniquely to identify a product content.

E.g.: WPX"

PlcOfDischCd.description:
Place of discharge code

To identify a seaport, airport, freight terminal, rail station or other place at which goods are unloaded from the means of transport
having been used for their carriage.

The information is derived from Shipment plan execution and the Shipment processing throug Company network.

PlcOfLoadCd.description:
Place of loading code

To identify a seaport, airport, freight terminal, rail station or other place at which goods are loaded onto the means of transport being
used for their carriage.

The information is derived from Shipment plan execution and the Shipment processing throug Company network.

PlnDtm.description: Shipment Planned Date time – Expected datetime of physical handover to Company from Shipper

items.description: Shipment processing facility details.

PwkInd.description:
Shipment paperwork indicator: "Indicates whether there is paperwork related to the shipment.
Y=Yes,
N=No"

RelCoInd.description:
Related company indicator: "An indication that, during the fiscal year, either the USPPI or foreign ultimate consignee reported owned 10% or more of the other?s voting securities.
Y = Yes; Companies related.
N = No; Companies NOT related.

The INDICATOR IS used ON export control.

DDM review: IN data MODEL should be represented AS relationship BETWEEN two business parties."

items.description: Document line response status. The result of the document processing.

RtdExTrInd.description:
Routed export transaction indicator

Indicates that buyer/receiver authorizes an agent to facilitate the export of items from the the country of origin on their behalf. The buyer/receiver also authorizes the preparation and filing of the electronic export information.

This could be US specific definition:
Routed Export Transaction is when a Foreign Principal Party in Interest (FPPI) authorizes a U.S. agent to facilitate export of items from the United States on its behalf and also prepare and file the shipment.

items.description: Shipment documentation identifier: "The unique identifier for a shipment document. For the contract with the customer, ie. the waybill, the identifier is the waybill number."
Additional information provided about a shipment, to support the pickup and transport within the Company Network.

ShpId.description:
Shipment business key (legacy).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

ShpKey.description:
Shipment business key (target).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

items.description:
Shipment reference: 

Any reference that a business party involved in the transaction wants to assign to the piece.
Shipment service

Shipment service charge.

An additional fee charged by Company to a customer for a special service related to a specific Shipment.
Provides a flexible tool for a capture of Service specific data elements.

GlSrvCd.description: Service type code. The GALOP code.

items.description: Shipment Status

VltnMthCd.description:
Customs valuation method coded

Valuation Method codes
1 Transaction value of the imported goods
2 Transaction value of identical goods
3 Transaction value of similar goods
4 Deductive value method
5 Computed value method
6 Value based on the data available (fall-back method)

AvlDtm.description: Image available datetime: The time at which the data is available and can be returned by image archive solution.

CCrpLglEntCd.description: Captured corporate legal entity code: "A unique identifier of a billing entity, also called a Company company code or CREST code."

CDtm.description: Image captured datetime: The date and time that Image was cpatured. E.g. by photo camera or on a scanner.

CIndvId.description:
Image captured user name individual identifier: 

The unique identifier of an individual.

Captured operation function identifier.

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that captured the image.

Image captured user name.

The name that uniquely identify a user within a system or set of systems.

e.g. LDAP USER ID

EnCdTy.description: Image.Image encoding type:Format of image file.  List of allowable values maintained by CPI CRB. Three-letter code should follow PC standards for file name extensions. Currently allowed: TIF  TIFF file

ImgId.description: Image identifier:A number that uniquely identifies an image.

Loc.description: Image location:Complete location needed to download the image. Follows format specified in Image Location Type field.

MimeTy.description: Image mime type:Specifies MIME type of Image Encoding List of allowable values maintained by CPI CRB. Currently allowed: image/tiff

RDtm.description:
Image recording datetime: Data Entry Timestamp (Insertion Timestamp)

The data entry timestamp identifies the moment in time that the Image details become available to a business application on an on-line computer system.

Event recording user name: 

The unique identifier of an individual.

Recording operation function identifier: 

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that recorded the image.

Event recording user name.

The name that uniquely identify a user within a system or set of systems.

e.g. LDAP USER ID

Shipment document can have associated another Shipment or Movement document.

BdTyCd.description: Bond type code: "There are many types of bonds required by Customs  Border Protection (CBP) for various reasons. While TRG has the experience and expertise to provide every type, the most common types issued are:AC1=Import bondA1a=Drawback bondAC2=Custodian of Bonded MerchandiseAC3=International carrierAC4=Foregin Trade Zone"

items.description: Shipment document business party roles and their details.
Case associated with the document.

CatCd.description:
Declaration category code

Is a category under which the goods are declared to customs. The values are FRML,DM,LVD,LVND. So do we have any field in CM to hold these values.

CurCd.description:
Regulatory declaration ISO currency code

Identifies the the currency in which is the declaration submited to the regulatory. Usually is it the local currency.

items.description:
Customs charge

A code to identify the rate of tax that was levied.
e.g. VAT or duty, airport, excise, postal tax, carrier tax.

The charge code is defined by the regulatory body in the country and can be only interpreted within the scope of reference data defined by the regulatory body which levied the customs charge.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

DngGdsInd.description:
Dangerous good indicator

Indicates if there is at least one item which is flagged as a dangerous good.(We need this at declaration level because  in the manifest submission we don’t have the line item details.

DocId.description:
Shipment documentation identifier

The  unique identifier for a shipment document. For the contract with the customer, ie. the waybill, the identifier is the waybill number.

DocSbTyCd.description:
Document sub type code

Identifies uniquely a document sub type.

The authoritative source of the document sub type reference data is Company SOP.

items.description:
Shipment document sub type name

De-normalized from document sub type reference data.

DocTyCd.description:
Document type code

Identifies uniquely a document type., e.g.Visa, export licence, import licence, SGS certificate, commercial invoice, certificate of origin.

The authoritative source of the document type reference data is Company SOP.

items.description:
Shipment document type name

De-normalized from document type reference data.

Dtm.description:
Shipment documentation datetime

The date and time the document was created.

items.description: Information about Shipment Document events.

The exchange rate between base currency and this ISO currency acting as foreign/other currency.

Many exchange rate types can be defined by Company.

Ie, 1.00 USD = 0.76 EUR, then the exchange rate is "0.76" and the base currency.

"BCurCd" is "USD"; The other currecny "OCurCd" is "Euro".

An amount in OCurCd devided by the exchange rate gives an amount in BCurCd.

An amount in BCurCd nultiplied by the exchange rate gives an amount in OCurCd.

ExpCtryCd.description:
Exportation country code

Could be different from Ship from country code.

ExpDt.description:
The date the goods is exported.

Derived from Movement departure date.

ExpLicCd.description:
Export licence code

Export License Code indicates the type of export license, export permit, license exemption, license exception or other export authorization.

This is based solely on the commodity type being exported. The license code associated with a commodity may indicate that the shipper must have a license to export the commodity, but it’s not the shipper that is determining the need for a license, it is the commodity. 

Reference to industry standard: Permit Type / Permit No:  Export License Code is a permit or exemption type.  It will indicate that a license number is to be reported and the type of license, or the authorization for not providing a license number. 
 
It is mandatory for all EEI filings.  In other words, if a shipment’s category is FRML and the shipper has not provided an ITN and DCE cannot assign an exemption through normal workflow, then an EEI filing is required and the Export License Code is mandatory.

ExpLicNo.description:
Shipment documentation export license

The export license used by the customer.

Fnc.description:
The document function in the particular business transaction.
e.g. Import declaration, Export declaration

items.description:
Generic request criteria.

The request can be further specifield with the usage of this complex type element.

Service operation needs to be specified in the implementation guide.

GovProcTyCd.description:
Government procedure type code

A code used by customs to facilitate clearence, e.g. 
IM4 - Permamently import

WCO definition: Code specifying the government procedure, if any, which has been applied to the goods.

ImpCtryCd.description:
Importation country code

Could be different from Ship to country code.

ImpLicCd.description:
Import licence code

Import License Code indicates the type of import license, import permit, license exemption, license exception or other import authorization.

This is based solely on the commodity type being imported. The license code associated with a commodity may indicate that the receiver/importer must have a license to import the commodity, but it’s not the receiver/importer that is determining the need for a license, it is the commodity.

ImpLicNo.description: Shipment documentation import license: The import license used by the customer.

IncTrmCd.description:
Incoterm code: "Defines uniquely an Incoterm. 

The international standard codes, not the Company Express specified Terms of Trade.

Company Express started to use the service codes instead.

IncTrmPlcCd.description:
Incoterm place code

Identifier of the point or port of departure, shipment or destination, as required under the applicable delivery term.

items.description: Regulatory declaration document line

Loc.description:
Shipment documentation locator

The location of the image of the document on the internet.Value is a  URL (Universal Resource Locator), which  is a general purpose internet addressing protocol, used in WWW (HTTP) service.

ManCtryCd.description:
Country of manufacture code.

Also known as goods origin country code.

items.description:
Regulatory declaration measure

The measures which can be required for a regulatory document.

Currently is known requirement only for Total gross weight.

The code: TOT - Regulatory declaration total

Regulatory document monetary amount

With a Regulatory document can be associated various monetary amounts, like total invoice amount. This entity provides an actual amount and type captured at and required by processing of a particular regulatory declaration.

MthCd.description:
Declaration Method Code

Typically there is standard (more complex) and simplified declaration for some declaration procedures. This indicator is used to show if the declaration was submitted using standard or simplified procedure.
STAND - for Standard
SIMPL - for Simplified

items.description: Movement and Movement document details

NoOfSeals.description:
Number of seals

To specify the number of seals affixed.

items.description: Obligation Guarantee
Piece in document

PrevGovProcTyCd.description:
Previous government procedure type code

Code specifying the government procedure, if any, which has been applied to the goods prior
to the application of a different government procedure.

items.description: Declaration quantity.

ReaForTrCd.description:
Reason for transaction code
A code uniquely identifying a reason for the trade transaction.
Reason for exporting/importing the part, e.g. temporary, permanent.
This reason for transaction applies to all document lines in the document.
If a reason for transaction is provided on document line level, then it needs to be specified at all document lines and document level reason code doesn't apply.

items.description: Reference assigned to the document.

Regulatory Declaration Number

Reference number, assigned or accepted by Customs, to identify a goods declaration.

ReglBdCd.description: Regulatory body code: The unique identifier of a business party.

items.description: Document line response status. The result of the document processing.

RevsnNo.description:

Indicates whether there has been more than one revision of this particular document.

items.description:

Any comments to shipment document can be mentioned here.

items.description: Identification of the Seal

Shipment document customer roles and their details
Data element group.

ShpId.description:
Shipment business key (legacy).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

ShpKey.description:
Shipment business key (target).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

ShpTrnsTyCd.description:
Shipment transit type code

Indicates whether the declared Shipments are moved from Company GTW to Company GTW or directly to Receiver.

INT - Declaration covers a Company internal GTW to GTW Shipment transit.
RCV - Shipments to be delivered to the receiver.

items.description: Special programme

No.description:
Programme Number 

Indicates the identifier of the special programme which is used. There might be more than one special program per declaration.
Very often named as "preferential treatment" as well. alphanumeric
In German: "Besondere Behandlung". alphanumeric

Ty.description:
Special programme type

Indicates what kind of special programme is used for the line item such as preferential agreement EU-MX, duty exemption regime for pharma products. Usually identified by a code. There might be more than one special program per item.
Very often named as "preferential treatment" as well.

items.description:
Service charge

Additional Company service charges levied on Regulatory declaration as part of Shipment transportation contract and related charges.

Shipmenet document statuses.

Shipmenet document can have one or more statuses of a status type at a moment.

Only one status of one type is allowed for a Shipmenet document at a moment.

TotNoOfArtcl.description:
Total number of articles

Count of the total number of goods items within a declaration.

WCO definition for Number of Packages:
Number of individual items packaged in such a way that they cannot be divided without first undoing the packing.

WCO definition for Total Number of Packages:
Count of total number of packages of the entire declaration/Shipment.

TyCd.description:
Regulatory declaration type code. 

Code specifying the name of a document.

VltnMthCd.description:
Customs valuation method coded

Valuation Method codes
1 Transaction value of the imported goods
2 Transaction value of identical goods
3 Transaction value of similar goods
4 Deductive value method
5 Computed value method
6 Value based on the data available (fall-back method)

items.description: Position content: Content of the formated address position.

Alt.description: Geo position altitude: "The vertical distance of a level, a point or an object considered as a point, measured from mean sea level."

Lat.description:
Geo position latitude: "Also called the Parallel. The distance north or south of the equator of a point on the earth s surface. This distance is measured in degrees, minutes, and seconds. Lines (parallels) of latitude circle the earth horizontally and are parallel to one another. One minute of latitude equals one nautical mile.
(south latitudes are negative)"

Lgtd.description:
Geo position longitude: "Also called the meridian.
The distance east OR west OF the prime meridian OF a point ON the earth s surface. Longitude IS measured IN degrees, minutes AND seconds. Lines (meridians) OF longitude CREATE a geographic grid around the world AND are NOT PARALLEL, but rather converge AT the poles.
(West longitude IS depicted BY negative VALUES.)"

items.description:
Activity point location Building or construction

Postal address element identifying the number or name and type of the building or construction in or adjacent to which a delivery point is located.

NOTE 1 This element appears in the delivery point specification segment. It comprises the element sub-types preceding building/construction type,  succeeding building/construction type, and building/construction indicator.

EXAMPLE Batiment A, Block 7, Houseboat, London Tower

NOTE 2 This element and its sub-types comprise two levels of  building/construction, in order to account for situations in which an individual building/construction is designated along with a building complex. The building/construction element at each level comprises the element sub-types preceding building/construction type, succeeding  building/construction type, and building/construction indicator.

Door.description:
Door

UPU ID: U40.32

Postal address element indicating the apartment, room or office in, at or adjacent to which a delivery point which is situated within a building is located.

NOTE This element appears in the delivery point specification segment and in the mail recipient despatching information segment. In each segment, it comprises the element sub-types door type and door indicator.

Floor.description:
Floor

UPU ID: U40.31

Postal address element indicating the floor or level on which a delivery point is located in a multi-story construction.

NOTE This element appears in the delivery point specification segment and in the mail recipient despatching information segment. In each segment, it comprises the element sub-types floor type and floor indicator.

LocId.description:
Location identifier.

Unique identifier of a Location.

Strw.description:
Stairwell

UPU ID: U40.30

Postal address element indicating access to floor or door within a building/construction.
NOTE This element appears in the delivery point specification segment and in the mail recipient despatching information
segment. In each segment, it comprises the element sub-types stairwell type and stairwell indicator.
EXAMPLE Escalier

SuppActPntDat.description:
Supplementary activity point data.

Postal address element providing additional data or instructions intended to facilitate access to, or designation of, a delivery point

NOTE This element appears in the delivery point specification segment. It comprises element sub-types for two occurrences specified as positions.

EXAMPLE "Opposite number 23", "50 metres to the left of the main door", “Cruce Con Calle Obregon”

items.description:
Thoroughfare name

UPU ID: 40.21-1-1

Postal address element which identifies the road or part of a road or other access route along which a delivery point can be accessed, either directly or via a secondary or tertiary road or access route.

Wing.description:
Wing

Postal address element identifying, for a delivery point, the building/construction section in which it is housed and/or the main entry door through which it is accessed.

NOTE This element appears in the delivery point specification segment and in the mail recipient despatching information segment. In each segment, it comprises the element sub-types wing type and wing indicator.

items.description: Country division

CtyDist.description:
City district.

Postal address element giving the name of the hamlet, estate, or area within or adjacent to town, in which a delivery point is located, or via which it is accessed for postal delivery purposes.

NOTE 1 This element appears in the delivery point specification segment. It comprises element sub-types for four levelsinstances of district/sector, each with two positions, with and for a type and indicator for each level and
positioninstance.

NOTE 2 A district/sector may be a commonly known name for an area, or it may be an area assigned for a postal or administrative purposes. A district or sector may be one of a number of areas with a similar naming structure that may include a type and indicator structure.

EXAMPLE Arrondissement, Conjunto, Colonia Juarez, Kebele 4, Moo 11

This domain is generally used for communication numbers.

For a telephone number, the following breakdown must be used:

Communication number = Country dial code + Area dial code + Local dial code.

CM_DMN:ConfL.description:
Confidentiality Level: The Corporate Information Security Standard (CISS) defines that all organization information stored and distributed aither internally or externally must be clssified according its confidentiality level into one of four classes:
0 - Unclassified
1 - For Internal Use
2 - Restricted
3 - Confidential

Confidentiality level is used as indicator how a HI needs to be processed by human and systems.

3 - Confidential: This level requires encryption of the HI Description attribute.

CM_DMN:CurCd_3.description:

CM_DMN:CurExRtType_18_6.description:
The exchange rate from base currency to foreign/other currency.

e.g., 1.00 USD = 0.76 EUR, then the exchange rate is "0.76" and the base currency 
"BCurCd" is "USD" and the other currency "OCurCd" is "Euro".

An amount in OCurCd divided by the exchange rate gives an amount in BCurCd.

An amount in BCurCd multiplied by the exchange rate gives an amount in OCurCd.

CM_DMN:DatElGrpType.description:
Data element group.

Provides the flexible way of capturing additinal data elements without a need of the interface change.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

items.description:

CM_DMN:DtmType.description:
Date and time expressed in UTC.

http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime

Complete date plus hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds:
      YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD (e.g. 2018-07-16T19:20:30Z)
where:
     YYYY = four-digit year
     MM 	= two-digit month (01=January, etc.)
     DD  	= two-digit day of month (01 through 31)
     hh   	= two digits of hour (00 through 23) (am/pm NOT allowed)
     mm 	= two digits of minute (00 through 59)
     ss   	= two digits of second (00 through 59)
     s 	= three digits representing a decimal fraction of a second (000 through 999)
     TZD  = time zone designator (Z)

CM_DMN:DtmUTCType.description:

http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime

Complete date plus hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds:
      YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD (e.g. 2018-07-16T19:20:30Z)
where:
     YYYY = four-digit year
     MM 	= two-digit month (01=January, etc.)
     DD  	= two-digit day of month (01 through 31)
     hh   	= two digits of hour (00 through 23) (am/pm NOT allowed)
     mm 	= two digits of minute (00 through 59)
     ss   	= two digits of second (00 through 59)
     s 	= three digits representing a decimal fraction of a second (000 through 999)
     TZD  = time zone designator (Z)

North latitudes are positive

East latitudes are positive

Alt.description: Geo position altitude: "The vertical distance of a level, a point or an object considered as a point, measured from mean sea level."

Lat.description:
Geo position latitude: "Also called the Parallel. The distance north or south of the equator of a point on the earth s surface. This distance is measured in degrees, minutes, and seconds. Lines (parallels) of latitude circle the earth horizontally and are parallel to one another. One minute of latitude equals one nautical mile.
(south latitudes are negative)"

Lgtd.description:
Geo position longitude: "Also called the meridian.
The distance east OR west OF the prime meridian OF a point ON the earth s surface. Longitude IS measured IN degrees, minutes AND seconds. Lines (meridians) OF longitude CREATE a geographic grid around the world AND are NOT PARALLEL, but rather converge AT the poles.
(West longitude IS depicted BY negative VALUES.)"

items.description:
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Dtm.description:
Event datetime: 

The timestamp of the occurrence of the event and when it was captured.

Lat.description:
Geo position latitude: "Also called the Parallel. The distance north or south of the equator of a point on the earth s surface. This distance is measured in degrees, minutes, and seconds. Lines (parallels) of latitude circle the earth horizontally and are parallel to one another. One minute of latitude equals one nautical mile.
(south latitudes are negative)"

Lgtd.description:
Geo position longitude: "Also called the meridian.
The distance east OR west OF the prime meridian OF a point ON the earth s surface. Longitude IS measured IN degrees, minutes AND seconds. Lines (meridians) OF longitude CREATE a geographic grid around the world AND are NOT PARALLEL, but rather converge AT the poles.
(West longitude IS depicted BY negative VALUES.)"

RCd.description:
Event reason code: 

A code to uniquely identify an event reason.

RecDtm.description:
Event recording datetime: 

Data Entry Timestamp (Insertion Timestamp).

The data ENTRY TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event details BECOME available TO
a business application ON an ON-line computer SYSTEM. This could be the TIME that CHECKPOINT
details were entered through the keyboard USING an ON-line device, OR the TIME that information
FROM an OFF-line device such AS a courier scanner was downloaded AND the data uploaded TO the
backend systems."

RecIndvId.description:
Event recording user name: 

The unique identifier of an individual.

RecOpsFncId.description:
Recording operation function identifier: 

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that recorded the event. This identifier can be an identifier of a Route, Movement, facility etc.

RecUsrNm.description:
Event recording user name.

The application user name that uniquely identify a user within a system or set of systems.

e.g. LDAP USER ID

RecUsrNmTy.description:
Event recorded user name type.

The type of the user identifier provided in the Application user name/identifier. Such as: LDAP, email address

Rmk.description:
Event remark: 

Additional remarks provided as a reason for the event.

For Handling unit, Shipment or Piece: Event standard remark as defined in Checkpoint Business Guide.

SDtm.description:
Event send datetime: 

Event Issue Timestamp (Generation Timestamp)

The event issue TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event information IS sent FROM
the business application that records it TO the appropriate databases. IN most cases this will be the
TIME that the message IS passed FROM the business application TO the LOCAL communications
infrastructure."

ScnSw.description: Event scanner software: The name of the software used by the scanning device.

Rpl.description: Reply recipient. The ReplyTo header field contains a Destination supplied by a client when a message is sent. It is the destination where a reply to the message should be sent. Messages sent with a null ReplyTo value may be a notification of some event or they may just be some data the sender thinks is of interest. Messages sent with a ReplyTo value are typically expecting a response. A response may be optional; it is up to the client to decide.

Conf.description:
Confidentiality:
The Corporate Information Security Standard (CISS) defines that all organization information stored and distributed aither internally or externally must be clssified according its confidentiality level into one of four classes:
0 - Unclassified
1 - For Internal Use
2 - Restricted
3 - Confidential

Confidentiality level is used as indicator how a HI needs to be processed by human and systems.

3 - Confidential: This level requires encryption of the HI Description attribute.

CrDtm.description: The date and time when the handling instruction was created.

CreByBsnPtyRolTyCd.description: Business party role type code which created the Handlign Instruction.

items.description:
Handling Instruction data element group.

Additional information can be provided for a Handling instruction.

A Handling instruction type or category can require additional or complementary information to be captured togehter with its Description.
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Description: "Details to be provided for a specific handling instruction type.

items.description: Handling instruction event. The list of events capture progress, history and status update of the handling instruction.

Pri.description: Priority: "Defines in which priority the handling instruction should be processed:· 10 Low· 50 Medium· 70 HighThe values are 0 to 100. The reserved valuefor Low is 10, for Medium is 50, and for High is 70. Other priorities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 100."

ProcLvl.description:
Process level hierarchy.
Identifies uniquely a specific business process where the HI applies.

The Handling instruction can be applicable to a certain business process of a level in the hierarchy.

Sev.description: Severity: "Defines the severity of the handling instruction:The predefined severity levels, in order ofincreasing severity, are as follows:· 0 Unknown· 10 Information MUST be used for cases when the event contains only general information and is not reporting an error.· 20 Harmless MUST be used for cases in which the error event has no effect on the normal operation of theresource.· 30 Warning MUST be used when it is appropriate to let the user decide if an action is needed in response to the event.· 40 Minor MUST be used to indicate that action is needed, but the situation is not serious at this time.· 50 Critical MUST be used to indicate that an immediate action is needed and the scope is broad (perhaps an imminent outage to a critical resource will result).· 60 Fatal MUST be used to indicate that an error occurred, but it is too late to take remedial action.The associated values are 0 to 70. The reserved values start at 0 for Unknown andincrease by increments of 10 to 60 for Fatal. Other severities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 70. This is an OPTIONAL property."

St.description:
Status: "Status of the handling instruction to be updated during its life cycle.

CRE - Created
REC - Received
APP - Approved
ACC - Accepted
DEC - Declined
PRO - Processed
CLS - Closed"

SysEnvCd.description: System Environment Code: "The system Environment Code is used to identify whether this particular record is being created as a result of a ¿test¿ or as ¿production¿ level integration. Often times as new systems are brought online, testing must be performed in a production environment in order to ensure complete integration. This attribute allows the integrator to flag test messages as such. The systemEnvironmentCode attribute is an optional attribut.The data will be processed as production if the attribute is not specified. Allowed values: PROD - Production, TEST - Test"

BOKey.description:
Business Object Business Key

Business object unique identifier. The identifier can be a single data element or a composite key made of a number of data elements.

Each BO will have defined data element group and its code and a list of data elements building up the BO business key.

The list of data elements making the BO business key must be identical to the business keys defined in Company Express Data Model.

Sev.description: Severity: "Defines the severity of the handling instruction:The predefined severity levels, in order ofincreasing severity, are as follows:· 0 Unknown· 10 Information MUST be used for cases when the event contains only general information and is not reporting an error.· 20 Harmless MUST be used for cases in which the error event has no effect on the normal operation of theresource.· 30 Warning MUST be used when it is appropriate to let the user decide if an action is needed in response to the event.· 40 Minor MUST be used to indicate that action is needed, but the situation is not serious at this time.· 50 Critical MUST be used to indicate that an immediate action is needed and the scope is broad (perhaps an imminent outage to a critical resource will result).· 60 Fatal MUST be used to indicate that an error occurred, but it is too late to take remedial action.The associated values are 0 to 70. The reserved values start at 0 for Unknown andincrease by increments of 10 to 60 for Fatal. Other severities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 70. This is an OPTIONAL property."

The complex type is optional and may be required by use cases such as versioning or correlation.

HIId.description: Unique identifier of a handling instruction.

items.description: Handling instruction event. The list of events capture progress, history and status update of the handling instruction.

Pri.description: Priority: "Defines in which priority the handling instruction should be processed:· 10 Low· 50 Medium· 70 HighThe values are 0 to 100. The reserved valuefor Low is 10, for Medium is 50, and for High is 70. Other priorities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 100."

ProcLvl.description:
Process level hierarchy.
Identifies uniquely a specific business process where the HI applies.

The Handling instruction can be applicable to a certain business process of a level in the hierarchy.

RtId.description: Shipment identifier: An identification number assigned to a shipment, controlled by Company.

Sev.description: Severity: "Defines the severity of the handling instruction:The predefined severity levels, in order ofincreasing severity, are as follows:· 0 Unknown· 10 Information MUST be used for cases when the event contains only general information and is not reporting an error.· 20 Harmless MUST be used for cases in which the error event has no effect on the normal operation of theresource.· 30 Warning MUST be used when it is appropriate to let the user decide if an action is needed in response to the event.· 40 Minor MUST be used to indicate that action is needed, but the situation is not serious at this time.· 50 Critical MUST be used to indicate that an immediate action is needed and the scope is broad (perhaps an imminent outage to a critical resource will result).· 60 Fatal MUST be used to indicate that an error occurred, but it is too late to take remedial action.The associated values are 0 to 70. The reserved values start at 0 for Unknown andincrease by increments of 10 to 60 for Fatal. Other severities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 70. This is an OPTIONAL property."

St.description:
Status: "Status of the handling instruction to be updated during its life cycle.

CRE - Created
REC - Received
APP - Approved
ACC - Accepted
DEC - Declined
PRO - Processed
CLS - Closed"

SysEnvCd.description: System Environment Code: "The system Environment Code is used to identify whether this particular record is being created as a result of a ¿test¿ or as ¿production¿ level integration. Often times as new systems are brought online, testing must be performed in a production environment in order to ensure complete integration. This attribute allows the integrator to flag test messages as such. The systemEnvironmentCode attribute is an optional attribut.The data will be processed as production if the attribute is not specified. Allowed values: PROD - Production, TEST - Test"

Conf.description:
Confidentiality:
The Corporate Information Security Standard (CISS) defines that all organization information stored and distributed aither internally or externally must be clssified according its confidentiality level into one of four classes:
0 - Unclassified
1 - For Internal Use
2 - Restricted
3 - Confidential

Confidentiality level is used as indicator how a HI needs to be processed by human and systems.

3 - Confidential: This level requires encryption of the HI Description attribute.

CrDtm.description: The date and time when the handling instruction was created.

CreByBsnPtyRolTyCd.description: Business party role type code which created the Handlign Instruction.

items.description:
Handling Instruction data element group.

Additional information can be provided for a Handling instruction.

A Handling instruction type or category can require additional or complementary information to be captured togehter with its Description.
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Description: "Details to be provided for a specific handling instruction type.

ValShpDclInd.description:
Validate declarable shipment indicator.

If the "Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y then we want to consider if we are validating details for declarable and/or non-declarable shipments. 

 If the"Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y and the "Validate declarable shipment indicator" also set to Y  then declarable shipments will be validated against actual profile.

ValShpNDclInd.description:
