If the "Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y then we want to consider if we are validating details for declarable and/or non-declarable shipments. 

 If the"Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y and the "Validate non-declarable shipment indicator" also set to Y  then non-declarable shipments will be validated against actual profile.

ValShpDclInd.description:
Validate declarable shipment indicator.

If the "Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y then we want to consider if we are validating details for declarable and/or non-declarable shipments. 

 If the"Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y and the "Validate declarable shipment indicator" also set to Y  then declarable shipments will be validated against planned profile.

ValShpNDclInd.description:
Validate non-declarable shipment indicator.

If the "Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y then we want to consider if we are validating details for declarable and/or non-declarable shipments. 

 If the"Shipment validation required indicator" is set to Y and the "Validate non-declarable shipment indicator" also set to Y  then non-declarable shipments will be validated against planned profile.

items.description: Shipment charge: Information about fees applied to a shipment for transportation.  A shipment charge can be a charge based on the weight of the shipment or a charge dependent on the customer tariff agreement.

A collection of information about a shipment transaction that helps serve the customer needs depending on the customer role type, e.g. shipper, receiver, etc.

Issue/Plan:
1) The address attributes need to be removed and referenced address entity should be used instead. The attributes are used by on a lot of interfaces using Company CF and migration path needs to be defined.

2) We have two customers: Shipment customer and Customer. The double definition should be resolved.

Customs charge

A code to identify the rate of tax that was levied.
e.g. VAT or duty, airport, excise, postal tax, carrier tax.

The charge code is defined by the regulatory body in the country and can be only interpreted within the scope of reference data defined by the regulatory body which levied the customs charge.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

ExmtRqCd.description:
Exemption request code

Code 42 - Simultaneous release for free circulation and home use of goods which  are the subject of a VAT-exempt supply to another Member State and, when  applicable, an excise duty suspension.
Code  45 - Release of goods for free circulation and home use for either VAT or excise duties and their placing under the tax warehouse procedure.
Code 63 - Re-importation with simultaneous release for free circulation and home
use of goods which are the subject of a VAT-exempt supply to another Member State

Routed Export Transaction is when a Foreign Principal Party in Interest (FPPI) authorizes a U.S. agent to facilitate export of items from the United States on its behalf and also prepare and file the shipment.

ArrDtm.description:
The actual movement arrival datetime.

The actual UTC date and time of arrival of the movement is derived from the Movement event timestamp.

items.description:
Scheduled movement - Movement cutoff datetime.

The movement cutoff time is the date and time where operational processing must be completed for that movement This is for example the airline cutoff time where we must lodge shipments with them or miss the flight.  Analogous to the gate close time for a passenger flight.

The date time is expressed in UTC plus the departure facility local time zone offset.
Date is the same as scheduled departure date and should not be required to be entered by an user and taken from the scheduled departure date.

This is derived data element from Scheduled movement.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Movement document.

Movement can have associated many movement documents of many document types.

CM_MVMT:MvmtPlannedProfileType.description:
Movement planned profile

Movement planned profile is a kind of header entity which identifies the profile and provides its description.

The Movement planned profiles are prepared in advance by facility operational team and are assigned to the scheduled movements during movement management process.

The profile specifies in child entities shipment parameters which can or can not be loaded to a scheduled movement.

The profile is assigned to scheduled movement and used as a default profile for the movements created from the scheduled movements.

The profile can be further modified for the actual movement.

items.description:
Movement planned profile shipment product or service

Specifies the list of Shipment global product or services whose can be or can not be loaded into a Movement.

The Shipment with product or service Included - can be loaded into a Movement.
The Shipment with product or service Excluded- can NOT be loaded into a Movement.

Specifies the list of Shipment origins whose can be or can not be loaded into a Movement.

The Shipment origins can be specified on different level of granularity:
 - Company region
 - Country
 - Service area
 - Facility

The Shipment with origin Included - can be loaded into a Movement.
The Shipment with origin Excluded- can NOT be loaded into a Movement.

InclOrExclCd.description:

The shipment product or service can be either included or excluded from the profile.

If Included (I) then the Shipment can be loaded to the Movement with this profile.

If Excluded (E) then the Shipment can NOT be loaded to the Movement with this profile.

Iis populated with IATA airport code for air movements.

DstSrvaCd.description:
Movement destination service area code.

This information is de-normalized from Movement Destination Facility Identifier and should be used only for minimalization of the informarion lookup by each process.

items.description: Scheduled movement sector (leg)

MdOfTrns.description:
Mode of Transport: Identifies a Mode of transport.

The actual codes are defined in global reference data repository and should be aligned with the global standard.

The list should be aligned with international standard defined by UNECE:
1 - Maritime transport
2 - Rail transport
3 - Road transport
4 - Air transport
6 - Multimodal transport
7 - Fixed transport installation
8 - Inland water transport

SchArrDtm.description:
Movement scheduled arrival datetime.

The scheduled UTC date and time of arrival of the movement to the destination.

The local time offset and Time Zone code is the Movement destiantion location  local offset and Time zone code.

SchDptDtm.description:
Scheduled movement departure datetime

The scheduled UTC date and time of departure of a movement.

The local time offset and Time Zone code is the Movement origin location  local offset and Time zone code.

Vehicle Type

L.description: Length: The length of a piece.

NetWgt.description: Net weight: The net weight of the piece.

VolWgt.description: Volumetric weight: A calculated weight based on the piece volume.

W.description: Width: The width of a piece.

Wgt.description: Weight: The weight of a piece.

Piece reference:

CM_Pcs:PcsRqstType.description: Copy of PcsType wher all data elments are all optional for support of Query message types.

CsId.description: Case identifier: A unique identifier of a case.

items.description:
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

DatId.description:
Piece data identifier: "An identifier closely related to the License plate, which is represented in the Piece Identifier. Data Identifier - DI - (standard ANSI/FACR-1) It is an alphanumeric string indicating the inteded use of the data, e.g. part number or quantity. The DI is made up of 0 to 3 numerics followed by an upper case alphabetic (Company uses ""J"").
AS a sysnonym TO DI IS Application Identifier - AI - (ANS/UCC-4 OR UCC/EAN-128). The AI can be 2 TO 4 DIGITS LONG."

items.description:
Piece description: 

A brief description of the Piece with a specified type of description.

EstDlvDtm.description:
Piece estimated delivery datetime (EDD).

The estimated delivery date/time Company calculates as the shipment moves through the network to destination/final delivery. The EDD starts out as the CDD and may be adjusted during transit. The EDD is held at shipment and piece level, and is business-mandatory. v The EDD is displayed to customers as per its network display rules.

items.description: Piece measurements.
Additional information provided about a Piece, to support the pickup and transport within the Company Network.

PcsId.description:
Piece identifier: "A number that uniquely identifies a piece associated with a shipment.
A piece identifier can be a licence plate."

items.description:
Piece reference: 

Any reference that a business party involved in the transaction wants to assign to the piece.

PkgTyCd.description:
Piece packaging type code:

Defines the different types of packinging that for a piece.

RcvSpecDlvDtm.description:
Piece receiver specified delivery datetime (RDD).

The estimated delivery date/time the Receiver, or the Receiver’s authorized representative, has requested and Company has accepted/validated. The RDD is only relevant, and will only be present, if a Receiver has requested a delivery date, delivery time or delivery date/time change, or has requested disposition of the shipment that causes such a change (e.g. redirect).  The RDD is held at shipment and piece level and is business-conditional. The RDD is displayed to customers as the current EDD.

Rmk.description: Piece remark: Any additional information related to a piece can be entered here.

items.description:
Piece sort code

Only one sort code for one sort code type can be defined for a peice.

Piece status code

The piece status can change during the piece life cycle and this entity describes the piece lifecycle statuses.

Piece can have parallel status types during its lifecycle.

Status code describes the state.

Just one state of a state type is possible and allowed.

TyCd.description:
Piece type code.

Piece type is one of the factors defining network handling. The piece type is mainly defined by Piece dimensions and weight.

The Piece types can for example be:
Flyer: FLY
Conveyable: COY
Small Non Conveyable: NCY
Large Non Conveyable: LCY
Pallet: PAL

CM_REF:CountryOfficeRestrictionType.description:
Country office restriction
Entity represents following business rule:

No country may have more than one Country Office (CO) per network
type 
o That means that a pure TD country can only have one country office.

o A European country may have one TD country office and one DD
country office 
o Technically, the combinations CO-TD and CO-DD may not be used more
than once per country each. 
o A country with two networks but a shared CO for both networks would
have this configured as one facility and two Facility Functions CO-TD
and CO-DD 
o Each country needs to enter exactly one CO Facility Function for
each Network supported. That means that each pure TD country must have
exactly one CO Facility Function.

CtryCd.description:
This country defined the facility as country office for this network
type.

items.description: Data element group.

FcFncNtwTyCd.description:
A code to differentiate on the network.
Values are:
DDI  =Day Definite International
DDD  =Day Definite Domestic
TDI  =Time Definite International
TDD  =Time Definite Domestic
THP =Third Party

Some business objects can be allocated to multiple network types
through relationship entities.

FcId.description:
Defines uniquely a physical location in Company.

This code consists of a 3-character Service Area Code (linked to a
valid IATA code, and often identical to it) and a 3-character Facility
Code.

The harmonized facility identifier for globally unique facility
identification.

FcTyCd.description: In this specific case = Country Office

TDI  =Time Definite International

THP =Third Party

through relationship entities.

Uses A for alphabetic and 9 for numbers characters.  

It can also include spaces and hyphens.

Country postcode pattern code form, in Company Information systems 
E.g.

AA999AA

Country postcode pattern code: 99999-9999  Postcode normalized form:
999999999

form: 9999

Defines uniquely an Incoterm. These are following codes:

EXW - Ex Works (. named place)
FCA - Free Carrier (. named place)
FAS - Free Alongside Ship (. named port of shipment)
FOB - Free on Board (. named port of shipment)
CFR - Cost and Freight (. named port of destination)
CIF - Cost, Insurance and Freight (. named port of destination)
CPT - Carriage Paid To (. named place of destination)
CIP - Carriage and Insurance Paid To (. named place of destination)

DAF - Delivered at Frontier (. named place)
DES - Delivered Ex Ship (. named port of destination)
DEQ - Delivered Ex Quay (. named port of destination)
DDU - Delivered Duty Unpaid (. named place of destination)
DDP - Delivered Duty Paid (. named place of destination)

BulkPuMinNoOfPcs.description:
Minimal threshold of pieces to be picked up in
order to allow a bulk Pickup. 

The courier needs to enter the amount of pieces he wants to pick up,
which should lie above this threshold in order to be able to perform a
Bulk PU. Otherwise he should get a warning message forcing the courier
to
perform a stnadard pickup and scan all pieces.

This is a configuration item for managing pickup process.

GlStCd.description:
Country global status code : A code indicating whether or not the specified  Company COUNTRY is open to accept shipments from international origins. This can be one of the following values:
A = "Service Available"
S = "Service Suspended; temporarily closed for less than the next 3 months"
U = "Service Unavailable; closed for more than the next 3 months, but details will not be deleted from ESD"
Y = "Not yet open; will open within 3 months"
X = "Closed; no service planned for at least the next 3 months, therefore details will be deleted permanently from ESD"

items.description:
Definition of customs shipment value limits.

The limits are defined on for country, but are only appplicable on
postal location level.

These limits serve as imput paramaters for capability determination.

The value limits affect transit times due to import or export
processes.

which a business party operates.  These codes enable local reporting
requirements to be met and offer  a further level of granularity to
the Industry code entity.

IntlDialInPhoneNo.description: Country international dial in phone number : International Country Phone Number is the number to dial in order to reach the specified COUNTRY, from another COUNTRY, once a connection to an international phone line has been established

IntlDialOutPhoneNo.description: Country international dial out phone number : International Access Phone Number is the number to dial within the specified COUNTRY in order to access an international phone line.

LicPlatNo.description:

JD00009 - NETHERLANDS
JD00002 - BELGIUM

JD00008 - FRANCE
JD00006 - SPAIN
JD00016 - PORTUGAL

items.description:
Is the name by which a country is commonly known, but which not
necessarily is the official name of the country.

NmSdx.description: Country name soundex : The soundex for the country name.

ObBilExtInd.description: Country outbound billing external indicator : A flag indicating whether or not shipments exiting the specified country may be externally billed.

ObColTrnsInd.description: Country outbound collect transport indicator : A flag indicating whether or not shipment charges can be paid by the receiver for shipments exiting the specified country.

items.description:
Entity represents following business rule:

No country may have more than one Country Office (CO) per network
type 
o That means that a pure TD country can only have one country office.

o A European country may have one TD country office and one DD
country office 
o Technically, the combinations CO-TD and CO-DD may not be used more
than once per country each. 
o A country with two networks but a shared CO for both networks would
have this configured as one facility and two Facility Functions CO-TD
and CO-DD 
o Each country needs to enter exactly one CO Facility Function for
each Network supported. That means that each pure TD country must have
exactly one CO Facility Function.

OfclValLmt.description:
Country official value limit : Contains the maximum declared value a shipment may not exceed when transported by Company into the Company COUNTRY. This limit is set
by legal/customs authorities.
Specifying 99999999.99 (8*9.99) identifies an unlimited value range.

PoLocTy.description:
Specifies default postal location type for a country. 
The postal location type can be defined differently for postal
locations.
More postal location types can be used within one country.

PoSortInd.description: Country postal sort indicator : Postal Sort indicates that the country is completely covered by a set of postal areas managed by the country PTT which can be used for sorting parcels. When this is true all city's must be attached to a postal area before the country can be made operational.

NtwTyCd.description:

DDI  =Day Definite International
DDD  =Day Definite Domestic
TDI  =Time Definite International
TDD  =Time Definite Domestic
THP =Third Party
Some business objects can be allocated to multiple network types
through relationship entities.

TyCd.description:
A unique identifier of a class of facilities with similar
characteristics. 
Sample list of facility type codes:
SC - Service Centre
TP - Third Party
AG - Agent
CO - Country Office
DC - Data Centre
Facility function type is the right name, but "Facility type" is
broadly known.

CM_REF:FacilityType.description:
An addressed location where Company business functions are performed.
Examples: Dominion Office, Country Office, Express Centre, Drop Box.

AddDs.description:
Facility additional days - The additional number of days required before a pickup can be made
for a specific facility.

Cd.description:
A three letter code that together with service area code uniquely
identifies facility.
Business rules:
A facility that moves packages always needs to have a three-digit
Facility Code. Two-digit facility codes are left to non-operational
facilities such as CO for country office
A gateway should always have the Facility Code GTW. If there are more
than one Gateway in a Service Area, further facilities should have the
codes GT2, GT3
Whenever possible, existing Service Area Codes should not be used as
Facility Codes, other than within the same Service Area, e.g. BOGBOG
for Bogotá/CO

CrossStr.description:
Facility cross street- Cross Street is the closest intersecting street, or other meaningful
identifier, that helps to indicate the physical location of the
specified Facility.

items.description: Data element group.

Associates the facility with the different types of functions that it
offers.

Id.description:
Defines uniquely a physical location in Company.
The identifier was historically derived from a 3-character Service
Area Code (linked to a valid IATA code, and often identical to it) and
a 3-character Facility Code, but both codes are attributes of Facility
and can be changed without changing the Facility identifieer.
The harmonized facility identifier for globally unique facility
identification.

LocAt.description:
Located At is free form text that describes how to actually locate a
Facility within its listed address.

qualifier - If there are several facilities of the same type in the same service
area, the facility qualifier distinguishes between them.  This
attribute currently contains numbers and is only useful from a
database perspective.

Facility Text is a free form text field containing information about

specific facility note.

SrvaCd.description:
A three-letter code that uniquely identifies a service area within
the Company operations network.
Is the service area where the facility is located.

StCd.description:
Facility status code - A flag indicating the operating status of the specified SERVICE AREA.
Status Codes are split into two classes - "Operational" and "Non
Operational".
"Operational", which includes
A - "Service Available",
S - "Service Suspended",
U - "Service Unavailable",
indicates that all business rules are enforced and business
applications can trust the integrity of the data for the service area.
"Non Operational", which includes
Y - "Not Yet Open"
X - "Closed",
indicates that not all business rules are enforced and the data, for
the service area, may not be complete. 
When a service area is "Non Operational" business applications canNOT
trust the integrity of the data for the service area.

TyDscr.description:

F - Company Facility
D - Droppoint

Ie, 1.00 USD = 0.76 EUR, then the exchange rate is "0.76" and the base currency.

"BCurCd" is "USD"; The other currecny "OCurCd" is "Euro".

An amount in OCurCd devided by the exchange rate gives an amount in BCurCd.

An amount in BCurCd nultiplied by the exchange rate gives an amount in OCurCd.

Postcode type
  A Postcode is a code administered by the national postal service

delivery areas.

This entity can be used as data reference and for postcode validation
purposes.

CtryCd.description:

country.  The code should be aligned to the ISO (ISO 3166-1-alpha-2
code elements) or in certain circumstances created by Company. 
Values are e.g.

significant character"

identify pickup and delivery areas used by the national postal
organisation.

service area's.

CM_REF:ServiceAreaType.description:
Service area

A Company globally-recognised and defined operational area within which Company services are provided.
When a service area is equal to an IATA the same code is used. Company has however, also defined local service areas, which are not equal to an IATA. This entity cover both the IATA and local service area.

CtryCd.description:
Country code.

Service area is defined within this country.

items.description: Data element group.

IATACd.description:
International Air Transportation Association Airport Code.

A three-character code, issued by the International Air Transportation Association, that uniquely identifies an airport.

Service area belongs to this IATA.

Nm.description:
Service area name.

Service Area Name is the full name of the specified service area, as uniquely identified by the Service Area Code.

OpDclInd.description:
Service area open for declarable indicator: 

Open for dutiable indicates whether or not a destination can receive dutiable shipments.

OpNDclInd.description:
Service area open for non-declarable indicator: 

A flag to indicate whether or not a destination can receive non-dutiable shipments.

SrvaCd.description:
Service area code

A three-letter code that uniquely identifies a service area within the Company operations network.
When a service area is equal to an IATA the same code is used. Company has however, also defined local service areas, which are not equal to an IATA. This entity cover both the IATA and local service area.

StCd.description:
Service area status code

A flag indicating the operating status of the specified SERVICE AREA. Status Codes are split into two classes - "Operational" and "Non Operational".

"Operational", which includes
A - "Service Available",
S - "Service Suspended",
U - "Service Unavailable",
indicates that all business rules are enforced and business applications can trust the integrity of the data for the service area.

"Non Operational", which includes
Y - "Not Yet Open"
X - "Closed",
indicates that not all business rules are enforced and the data, for the service area, may not be complete. 
When a service area is "Non Operational" business applications canNOT trust the integrity of the data for the service area.

CM_REF:ServiceHandlingNoteType.description:
Service handling Note type

A service note contains regulatory information regarding the handling
of shipments sent to a particular country or service area for which
Company employees and customers must be aware of when conducting business
with that country or service area.

Service Handling Note entity contains the different types of service
handling notes together with its country of origin and country of
destination or service area where the service handling notes are
applicable to. Each service handling note is associated with an
identifier which is used for tracking purposes. Examples of service
handling note types can be for example: 

Operations Note,
Prohibited Note,
Service Impact Note,
Customs Note,
Facility Off Hours Note,
Origin Status Note,
Physical Note,
Tracing Note,
Clearance Value Note

DLChTm.description:
Time zone day light change time

The exact time when Daylight Savings Time starts or ends for the Time zone.

DLSvCd.description:
Time zone day light saving code

The upto 5 character code by which the Daylight Savings Time in the timezone is normally referred (Eg. BST - British Summer Time, PDT - Pacific Daylight Time, etc)

DOWNo.description:
Time zone day light end day of week.

The day of the week (0-6, Sun-Sat) that Daylight Savings Time ends within a Time zone. Must be null if DST End1 dd is set and DST End2 dd is null as this indicates a fixed date at which DST ends. If set both End1 dd and End2 dd must be set to indicate the week within the month that DST ends.

M1.description:
Time zone day light end 1 month.

The first date in any year that Daylight Savings Time ends within a Time zone. If DST End2 dm is not set this indicates a fixed date at which DST ends within the year. If both End1 dm and End2 dm are set it indicates the end of the week that DST ends and DST End Day defines the day within the week.

XML schema type gMonthDay: Defines a part of a date - the month and day (MM-DD)

M2.description:
Time zone day light end 2 month

The last date in any year that Daylight Savings Time ends within a TIME ZONE. If DST End2 dm is not set this indicates that DST End1 dm is a fixed date at which DST ends. If both End1 dm and End2 dm are set it indicates the end of the week that DST ends and DST End Day defines the day within the week.

XML schema type gMonthDay: Defines a part of a date - the month and day (MM-DD)

Offset.description:
Time zone day light offset

The Daylight Savings Time offset, in hours and/or minutes, within a TIME ZONE. DST Offset must be specified in addition to the offset-from-gmt. If DST Offset is not specified daylight savings is not calculated for this timezone.

DOWNo.description:
Time zone day light start day of week.

The day of the week (0-6, Sun-Sat) that Daylight Savings Time begins within a Time zone. Must be null if DST Start1 dd is set and DST Start2 dd is null as this indicates a fixed date at which DST begins. If set both Start1 dd and Start2 dd must be set to indicate the week within the month that DST begins.

M1.description:
Time zone day light start 1 month

The first date in any year that Daylight Savings Time begins within a TIME ZONE. If DST Start2 dm is not set this indicates a fixed date at which DST begins within the year. If both Start1 dm and Start2 dm are set it indicates the start of the week that DST begins and DST Start Day defines the day within the week.

XML schema type gMonthDay: Defines a part of a date - the month and day (MM-DD)

M2.description:
Time zone day light start 2 month

The last date in any year that Daylight Savings Time begins within a Time zone. If DST Start2 dm is not set this indicates that DST Start1 dm is a fixed date at which DST begins. If both Start1 dm and Start2 dm are set it indicates the end of the week that DST begins and DST Start Day defines the day within the week.

XML schema type gMonthDay: Defines a part of a date - the month and day (MM-DD)

CM_REF:TradingBlocType.description:
Trading bloc type
A treaty agreed among a group of countries that defines a set of rules about goods transported to, from, and between trading bloc members in order to achieve mutual benefit.  Rules are recorded at the country level, and may involve an origin-destination pair of countries.
ExamplesL European Union, NAFTA and Mercosur.

NAFTA=Nafta
Mercosur=Mercosur.

Sev.description:
Severity
The perceived severity of the status the event is describing with respect to the
application that reports the event. The predefined severity levels, in order of
increasing severity, are as follows:
· 0 Unknown
· 10 Information MUST be used for cases when the event contains only general information and is not reporting an error.
· 20 Harmless MUST be used for cases in which the error event has no effect on the normal operation of the resource.
· 30 Warning MUST be used when it is appropriate to let the user decide if an action is needed in response to the event.
· 40 Minor MUST be used to indicate that action is needed, but the situation is not serious at this time.
· 50 Critical MUST be used to indicate that an immediate action is needed and the scope is broad (perhaps an imminent outage to a critical resource will result).
· 60 Fatal MUST be used to indicate that an error occurred, but it is too late to take remedial action.

The associated values are 0 to 70. The reserved values start at 0 for Unknown and
increase by increments of 10 to 60 for Fatal. Other severities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 70. This is an OPTIONAL property.

· 40 Minor MUST be used to indicate that action is needed, but the situation is not serious at this time.
· 50 Critical MUST be used to indicate that an immediate action is needed and the scope is broad (perhaps an imminent outage to a critical resource will result).
· 60 Fatal MUST be used to indicate that an error occurred, but it is too late to take remedial action.

The associated values are 0 to 70. The reserved values start at 0 for Unknown and
increase by increments of 10 to 60 for Fatal. Other severities MAY be added but MUST NOT exceed 70. This is an OPTIONAL property.

CDlvDtm.description:
Shipment committed delivery datetime (CDD).

The estimated delivery date/time that Company calculates following physical shipment acceptance (calculation is triggered in most cases by the PU scan). The CDD is always derived from Company’s standard customer-facing transit time, and does not change during transit.u The CDD represents Company’s delivery service commitment. The CDD is held at shipment level, and is business-mandatory.  The CDD is displayed to customers only as the first instance of the EDD.

items.description: Shipment charge: Information about fees applied to a shipment for transportation.  A shipment charge can be a charge based on the weight of the shipment or a charge dependent on the customer tariff agreement.

A collection of information about a shipment transaction that helps serve the customer needs depending on the customer role type, e.g. shipper, receiver, etc.

Issue/Plan:
1) The address attributes need to be removed and referenced address entity should be used instead. The attributes are used by on a lot of interfaces using Company CF and migration path needs to be defined.

2) We have two customers: Shipment customer and Customer. The double definition should be resolved.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

The estimated delivery date/time Company calculates as the shipment moves through the network to destination/final delivery. The EDD starts out as the CDD and may be adjusted during transit. The EDD is held at shipment and piece level, and is business-mandatory. v The EDD is displayed to customers as per its network display rules.

QDlvDtm.description:
Shipment quoted delivery datetime (QDD).

The estimated delivery date/time that Company calculates, and is quoted to the customer, at booking or shipment creation.  The QDD is always derived from Company’s standard customer-facing transit time.u  The QDD is held at shipment level, and is mandatory whenever captured (hence business-conditional).  If captured, the QDD is never presented/articulated to customers outside of the booking or shipment creation process.

RcvSpecDlvDtm.description:
Shipment receiver specified delivery datetime (RDD).

The estimated delivery date/time the Receiver, or the Receiver’s authorized representative, has requested and Company has accepted/validated. The RDD is only relevant, and will only be present, if a Receiver has requested a delivery date, delivery time or delivery date/time change, or has requested disposition of the shipment that causes such a change (e.g. redirect).  The RDD is held at shipment and piece level and is business-conditional. The RDD is displayed to customers as the current EDD.

A collection of information about a shipment transaction that helps serve the customer needs depending on the customer role type, e.g. shipper, receiver, etc.

Issue/Plan:
1) The address attributes need to be removed and referenced address entity should be used instead. The attributes are used by on a lot of interfaces using Company CF and migration path needs to be defined.

2) We have two customers: Shipment customer and Customer. The double definition should be resolved.

Customs charge

A code to identify the rate of tax that was levied.
e.g. VAT or duty, airport, excise, postal tax, carrier tax.

The charge code is defined by the regulatory body in the country and can be only interpreted within the scope of reference data defined by the regulatory body which levied the customs charge.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

DclInd.description:
Shipment declarable indicator.
Allowed values:
Y - Yes
N- No

Default value: N - No

Identifies whether or not a Shipment is Declarable to Inbound Customs for Import Clearance.

The indicator is derived from Shipment Product and de-normalized in this message for performance reasons.

DclNPcs.description: Shipment declared number of pieces: The number of pieces related to a shipment as declared by the customer.

items.description:
A list of Shipment delivery date time is required for a Shipment.

This entity allows for capture and maintenance of an unrestricted number of the Shipment delivery datetimes.

A brief description of the shipment with a specified type of description.

items.description: Information about Shipment events.

ExitCstOfcCd.description:
Exit customs office code

To identify the regulatory office at which the goods enter the customs territory of destination.

ExmtRqCd.description:
Exemption request code

Code 42 - Simultaneous release for free circulation and home use of goods which  are the subject of a VAT-exempt supply to another Member State and, when  applicable, an excise duty suspension.
Code  45 - Release of goods for free circulation and home use for either VAT or excise duties and their placing under the tax warehouse procedure.
Code 63 - Re-importation with simultaneous release for free circulation and home
use of goods which are the subject of a VAT-exempt supply to another Member State

items.description: A uniquely-identified part of a shipment that is packaged and handled separately.

Piece measurements as provided by customer in the cases where Piece
business object is not created yet and Piece identifier is not
assigned.

Is used to calculate the Shipper Dim Weight which is used by Billing
where Company has not reweighed pieces. Also used to validate variance
between Shipper declared Volumetric and Company Validated Volumetric.

PlcOfDischCd.description:
Place of discharge code

To identify a seaport, airport, freight terminal, rail station or other place at which goods are unloaded from the means of transport
having been used for their carriage.

The information is derived from Shipment plan execution and the Shipment processing throug Company network.

PlcOfLoadCd.description:

To identify a seaport, airport, freight terminal, rail station or other place at which goods are loaded onto the means of transport being

The information is derived from Shipment plan execution and the Shipment processing throug Company network.

RelCoInd.description:
Related company indicator: "An indication that, during the fiscal year, either the USPPI or foreign ultimate consignee reported owned 10% or more of the other?s voting securities.
Y = Yes; Companies related.
N = No; Companies NOT related.

The INDICATOR IS used ON export control.

DDM review: IN data MODEL should be represented AS relationship BETWEEN two business parties."

RtdExTrInd.description:
Routed export transaction indicator

Indicates that buyer/receiver authorizes an agent to facilitate the export of items from the the country of origin on their behalf. The buyer/receiver also authorizes the preparation and filing of the electronic export information.

This could be US specific definition:
Routed Export Transaction is when a Foreign Principal Party in Interest (FPPI) authorizes a U.S. agent to facilitate export of items from the United States on its behalf and also prepare and file the shipment.

BdTyCd.description: Bond type code: "There are many types of bonds required by Customs  Border Protection (CBP) for various reasons. While TRG has the experience and expertise to provide every type, the most common types issued are:AC1=Import bondA1a=Drawback bondAC2=Custodian of Bonded MerchandiseAC3=International carrierAC4=Foregin Trade Zone"

CusProcTyCd.description:
Customs procedure type code

A code used by customs to facilitate clearence, e.g. IM4 - Permamently import.

ExpLicCd.description:
Export licence code

Export License Code indicates the type of export license, export permit, license exemption, license exception or other export authorization.

This is based solely on the commodity type being exported. The license code associated with a commodity may indicate that the shipper must have a license to export the commodity, but it’s not the shipper that is determining the need for a license, it is the commodity. 

Reference to industry standard: Permit Type / Permit No:  Export License Code is a permit or exemption type.  It will indicate that a license number is to be reported and the type of license, or the authorization for not providing a license number. 
 
It is mandatory for all EEI filings.  In other words, if a shipment’s category is FRML and the shipper has not provided an ITN and DCE cannot assign an exemption through normal workflow, then an EEI filing is required and the Export License Code is mandatory.

ExpLicNo.description:
Shipment documentation export license

The export license used by the customer.

ImpLicCd.description:
Import licence code

Import License Code indicates the type of import license, import permit, license exemption, license exception or other import authorization.

This is based solely on the commodity type being imported. The license code associated with a commodity may indicate that the receiver/importer must have a license to import the commodity, but it’s not the receiver/importer that is determining the need for a license, it is the commodity.

ImpLicNo.description: Shipment documentation import license: The import license used by the customer.

Incoterm place code

Identifier of the point or port of departure, shipment or destination, as required under the applicable delivery term.

items.description:
The exchange rate between base currency and this ISO currency acting as foreign/other currency.

Many exchange rate types can be defined by Company.

Ie, 1.00 USD = 0.76 EUR, then the exchange rate is "0.76" and the base currency.

"BCurCd" is "USD"; The other currecny "OCurCd" is "Euro".

An amount in OCurCd devided by the exchange rate gives an amount in BCurCd.

An amount in BCurCd nultiplied by the exchange rate gives an amount in OCurCd.

Reference to industry standard: Permit Type / Permit No:  Export License Code is a permit or exemption type.  It will indicate that a license number is to be reported and the type of license, or the authorization for not providing a license number. 
 
It is mandatory for all EEI filings.  In other words, if a shipment’s category is FRML and the shipper has not provided an ITN and DCE cannot assign an exemption through normal workflow, then an EEI filing is required and the Export License Code is mandatory.

Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":

HrmnCmdtCd.description:
Represent codes as defined by Harmonized System Codes (HS Codes) plus country defined tarif extension.

The HTS is organized into 21 sections and 96 chapters, accompanied with general rules of interpretation and explanatory notes. The system begins by assigning goods to categories of crude and natural products, and from there proceeds to categories with increasing complexity. The codes with the broadest coverage are the first four digits, and are referred to as the heading. The HTS therefore sets forth all the international nomenclature through the 6-digit level and, where needed, contains added subdivisions assigned 2 more digits, for a total of 8 at the tariff-rate line (legal) level. Two final (non-legal) digits are assigned as statistical reporting numbers if warranted, for a total of 10 digits to be listed on entries.

See also: 
http://www.foreign-trade.com/reference/hscode.htm
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonized_System

The proper modeling would be to reuse HS codes and introduce an additional attribute for country tarif.


WCO definition:
Commodity classification: The non-commercial categorization of a commodity by a standard-setting organization.  First 6 digits must be the HS

The  unique identifier for a shipment document. For the contract with the customer, ie. the waybill, the identifier is the waybill number.

Document sub type code

Identifies uniquely a document sub type.

The authoritative source of the document sub type reference data is Company SOP.

items.description:
Shipment document sub type name

De-normalized from document sub type reference data.

DocTyCd.description:
Document type code

Identifies uniquely a document type., e.g.Visa, export licence, import licence, SGS certificate, commercial invoice, certificate of origin.

The authoritative source of the document type reference data is Company SOP.

items.description:
Shipment document type name

De-normalized from document type reference data.

Shipment documentation datetime

The date and time the document was created.

The document function in the particular business transaction.
e.g. Import declaration, Export declaration

Loc.description:
Shipment documentation locator

The location of the image of the document on the internet.Value is a  URL (Universal Resource Locator), which  is a general purpose internet addressing protocol, used in WWW (HTTP) service.

NoLnItm.description:
Shipment documentation total number of line items

Contains the total number of the line item of that shipment document.

RegDec.description: The Regulatory declaration document type details.

RevsnNo.description:
Shipment documentation revision number

Indicates whether there has been more than one revision of this particular document.

items.description:

Any comments to shipment document can be mentioned here.

ShpId.description:
Shipment business key (legacy).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

ShpKey.description:
Shipment business key (target).

Shipment business key is a composite key.
HWB number as the main value is stored as value of this element and the remaining values are provided as attributes of this element.

items.description:
Shipmenet document statuses.

Shipmenet document can have one or more statuses of a status type at a moment.

Only one status of one type is allowed for a Shipmenet document at a moment.

Additional Company service charges levied on Regulatory declaration as part of Shipment transportation contract and related charges.

Vehicle Type

The identification of the vehicle equipment type

BsFcId.description: Base facility identifier: "Defines uniquely a physical location in Company.This code consists of a 3-character Service Area Code (linked to a valid IATA code, and often identical to it) and a 3-character Facility Code.The harmonized facility identifier for globally unique facility identification."

DanGdsInd.description: Dangerous goods indicator: Indicate if the vehicle is allowed to handle dangerous goods.

items.description: Data element group.

DrvgLicTyCd.description: Driving licence type code: A unique identifier of a driving licence type.

FleetTy.description:
Fleet type: 

Identifies a mean of transport.

E.g.:
AIRPLAN
TRUCK
BICYCLE
BOAT
WALK

The actual codes are defined in global reference data repository.

MdOfTrns.description:
Mode of Transport: Identifies a Mode of transport.

The actual codes are defined in global reference data repository and should be aligned with the global standard.

The list should be aligned with international standard defined by UNECE:
1 - Maritime transport
2 - Rail transport
3 - Road transport
4 - Air transport
6 - Multimodal transport
7 - Fixed transport installation
8 - Inland water transport

PrfCourId.description: Preferred courier identifier: "The unique identifier of a courier.In data model derived from business party unique identifier."

The country code of the Country which issued the Vehicle registratio number.

VehLoL.description: Vehicle load length: The length available within the vehicle to accept loads.

VehLoVol.description: Vehicle load volume: The carrying volume available on the vehicle.

VehMxPcsL.description: Vehicle maximum piece length: The maximum length a piece can have to enter the vehicle.

VehSealInd.description: Vehicle sealable indicator: Indicates whether the vehicle can be sealed.

Alt.description: Geo position altitude: "The vertical distance of a level, a point or an object considered as a point, measured from mean sea level."

AvlDtm.description: Event available datetime: The time at which the data is available (and is the time that is returned by GQS).

CCrpLglEntCd.description: Captured corporate legal entity code: "A unique identifier of a billing entity, also called a Company company code or CREST code."

The unique identifier of an individual.

Event capture method code: "A code that uniquely identifies a capturing method, e.g.
SCA=Scan
KEY=Keyed
AUT=Automated
RTF=RF-tag."

COpsFncId.description:
Captured operation function identifier.

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that captured the event. This identifier can be an identifier of a Route, Movement, facility etc.

CUsrNm.description:
Event captured user name.

The application user name of the person which identified or is source of the event.

CUsrNmTy.description:
Event captured user name type.

The type of the user identifier provided in the Application user name/identifier. Such as: LDAP, email address

items.description:
Data element group.

In the case a set of data elements provide information value only as a group then these data elements will be grouped into one group.
E.g. 
 - Monetary amount and its currency
 - Dimension and unit of dimension
 - Communication device number and communication device type
 - Additional feature and associated charge amount, tax and currency 
 - vehicle mileage and unit of measurement

Single data elements providing information value will be always placed in event common group with 
Data element group code ser to "CommonGrp":
E.g.:
 - Vehicle Id
 - Destination facility identifier 
 - Seals Number

Dtm.description:
Event datetime: 

The timestamp of the occurrence of the event and when it was captured.

Lat.description:
Geo position latitude: "Also called the Parallel. The distance north or south of the equator of a point on the earth s surface. This distance is measured in degrees, minutes, and seconds. Lines (parallels) of latitude circle the earth horizontally and are parallel to one another. One minute of latitude equals one nautical mile.
(south latitudes are negative)"

Lgtd.description:
Geo position longitude: "Also called the meridian.
The distance east OR west OF the prime meridian OF a point ON the earth s surface. Longitude IS measured IN degrees, minutes AND seconds. Lines (meridians) OF longitude CREATE a geographic grid around the world AND are NOT PARALLEL, but rather converge AT the poles.
(West longitude IS depicted BY negative VALUES.)"

RCd.description:
Event reason code: 

A code to uniquely identify an event reason.

RecDtm.description:
Event recording datetime: 

Data Entry Timestamp (Insertion Timestamp).

The data ENTRY TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event details BECOME available TO
a business application ON an ON-line computer SYSTEM. This could be the TIME that CHECKPOINT
details were entered through the keyboard USING an ON-line device, OR the TIME that information
FROM an OFF-line device such AS a courier scanner was downloaded AND the data uploaded TO the
backend systems."

RecIndvId.description:
Event recording user name: 

The unique identifier of an individual.

RecOpsFncId.description:
Recording operation function identifier: 

Contains the specific identifier of the Operation function that recorded the event. This identifier can be an identifier of a Route, Movement, facility etc.

RecUsrNm.description:
Event recording user name.

The application user name that uniquely identify a user within a system or set of systems.

e.g. LDAP USER ID

RecUsrNmTy.description:
Event recorded user name type.

The type of the user identifier provided in the Application user name/identifier. Such as: LDAP, email address

Rmk.description:
Event remark: 

Additional remarks provided as a reason for the event.

For Handling unit, Shipment or Piece: Event standard remark as defined in Checkpoint Business Guide.

SDtm.description:
Event send datetime: 

Event Issue Timestamp (Generation Timestamp)

The event issue TIMESTAMP identifies the moment IN TIME that the event information IS sent FROM
the business application that records it TO the appropriate databases. IN most cases this will be the
TIME that the message IS passed FROM the business application TO the LOCAL communications
infrastructure."

ScnSw.description: Event scanner software: The name of the software used by the scanning device.

TyCd.description:
Event type code: 
The code uniquely identifying a valid event type.

anyOf.description:
Processes may be categorized as Routine, Non-Routine or Estimating.
An example of a Routine Process is recording costs of goods sold.
An example of a Non-Routine Process is recording Inventory Adjustments.
An example of an Estimating Process is determining Inventory Obsolsence.
Estimating Processes give wide lattitude to move the profit figure and attract a high degree of scrutiny.
Non Routine Processes tend to have fewer controls in place and are exposed to more risks.

qdt:DayDateType.description:
QDT000018
                                QDT
                                Day_ Date. Type
                                1.0
                                
                                Date
                                Day
                                string

qdt:DoubleNumericType.description:
QDT000005
                                QDT
                                Double_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                The double datatype corresponds to IEEE double-precision 64-bit floating point type [IEEE 754-1985]. The basic ·value space· of double consists of the values m × 2^e, where m is an integer whose absolute value is less than 2^53, and e is an integer between -1075 and 970, inclusive. In addition to the basic ·value space· described above, the ·value space· of double also contains the following special values: positive and negative zero, positive and negative infinity and not-a-number. The ·order-relation· on double is: x less than y iff y - x is positive. Positive zero is greater than negative zero. Not-a-number equals itself and is greater than all double values including positive infinity.
                                Numeric
                                Double
                                decimal

qdt:DurationMeasureType.description:
QDT000011
                                QDT
                                Duration_ Measure. Type
                                1.0
                                duration represents a duration of time. The ·value space· of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in § 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively. These components are ordered in their significance by their order of appearance i.e. as year, month, day, hour, minute, and second.
                                Measure
                                Duration

qdt:FloatNumericType.description:
QDT000004
                                QDT
                                Float_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                float corresponds to the IEEE single-precision 32-bit floating point type [IEEE 754-1985]. The basic·value space· of float consists of the values m × 2^e, where m is an integer whose absolute value is less than 2^24, and e is an integer between -149 and 104, inclusive. In addition to the basic ·value space· described above, the ·value space· of float also contains the following special values: positive and negative zero, positive and negative infinity and not-a-number. The ·order-relation· on float is: x less than y iff y - x is positive. Positive zero is greater than negative zero. Not-a-number equals itself and is greater than all float values including positive infinity.
                                Numeric
                                Float
                                decimal

qdt:HexBinaryObjectType.description:
QDT000001
                                QDT
                                Hex_ Binary Object. Type
                                1.0
                                hexBinary represents arbitrary hex-encoded binary data. The ·value space· of hexBinary is the set of finite-length sequences of binary octets.
                                Binary Object
                                Hex
                                binary

qdt:IntegerNumericType.description:
QDT000006
                                QDT
                                Integer_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                integer is ·derived· from decimal by fixing the value of ·fractionDigits· to be 0. This results in the standard mathematical concept of the integer numbers. The ·value space· of integer is the infinite set {.,-2,-1,0,1,2,.}. The ·base type· of integer is decimal.
                                Numeric
                                Integer
                                decimal

qdt:LanguageCodeType.description:
QDT000016
                                QDT
                                Language_ Code. Type
                                1.0
                                language represents natural language identifiers as defined by [RFC 1766]. The ·value space· of language is the set of all strings that are valid language identifiers as defined in the language identification section of [XML 1.0 (Second Edition)]. The ·lexical space· of language is the set of all strings that are valid language identifiers as defined in the language identification section of [XML 1.0 (Second Edition)]. The ·base type· of language is token.
                                Code
                                Language
                                string

                                1.0
                                
                                Date
                                Month
                                string

qdt:NegativeIntegerNumericType.description:
QDT000008
                                QDT
                                Negative Integer_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                negativeInteger is ·derived· from nonPositiveInteger by setting the value of ·maxInclusive· to be -1.  This results in the standard mathematical concept of the negative integers. The ·value space· of negativeInteger is the infinite set {.,-2,-1}. The ·base type· of negativeInteger is nonPositiveInteger.
                                Numeric
                                Negative Integer
                                decimal

qdt:NonNegativeIntegerNumericType.description:
QDT000010
                                QDT
                                Non Negative Integer_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                nonNegativeInteger is ·derived· from integer by setting the value of ·minInclusive· to be 0. This results in the standard mathematical concept of the non-negative integers. The ·value space· of nonNegativeInteger is the infinite set {0,1,2,.}. The ·base type· of nonNegativeInteger is integer.
                                Numeric
                                Non Negative Integer
                                decimal

qdt:NonPositiveIntegerNumericType.description:
QDT000009
                                QDT
                                Non Positive Integer_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                nonPositiveInteger is ·derived· from integer by setting the value of ·maxInclusive· to be 0. This results in the standard mathematical concept of the non-positive integers. The ·value space· of nonPositiveInteger is the infinite set {.,-2,-1,0}. The ·base type· of nonPositiveInteger is integer.
                                Numeric
                                Non Positive Integer
                                decimal

qdt:NormalizedStringType.description:
QDT000013
                                QDT
                                Normalized String_ Text. Type
                                1.0
                                normalizedString represents white space normalized strings. The ·value space· of normalizedString is the set of strings that do not contain the carriage return (#xD), line feed (#xA) nor tab (#x9) characters. The ·lexical space· of normalizedString is the set of strings that do not contain the carriage return (#xD) nor tab (#x9) characters. The ·base type· of normalizedString is string.
                                Text
                                Normalized String
                                string

qdt:PositiveIntegerNumericType.description:
QDT000007
                                QDT
                                Positive Integer_ Numeric. Type
                                1.0
                                positiveInteger is ·derived· from nonNegativeInteger by setting the value of ·minInclusive· to be 1.  This results in the standard mathematical concept of the positive integer numbers. The ·value space· of positiveInteger is the infinite set {1,2,.}. The ·base type· of positiveInteger is nonNegativeInteger.
                                Numeric
                                Positive Integer
                                decimal

qdt:StringType.description:
QDT000012
                                QDT
                                String_ Text. Type
                                1.0
                                The string datatype represents character strings in XML. The ·value space· of string is the set of finite-length sequences of characters (as defined in [XML 1.0 (Second Edition)]) that ·match· the Char production from [XML 1.0 (Second Edition)]. A character is an atomic unit of communication; it is not further specified except to note that every character has a corresponding Universal Character Set code point, which is an integer.
                                Text
                                String
                                string

qdt:TokenType.description:
QDT000014
                                QDT
                                Token_ Text. Type
                                1.0
                                token represents tokenized strings. The ·value space· of token is the set of strings that do not contain the line feed (#xA) nor tab (#x9) characters, that have no leading or trailing spaces (#x20) and that have no internal sequences of two or more spaces. The ·lexical space· of token is the set of strings that do not contain the line feed (#xA) nor tab (#x9) characters, that have no leading or trailing spaces (#x20) and that have no internal sequences of two or more spaces. The ·base type· of token is normalizedString.
                                Text
                                Token
                                string

qdt:URIType.description:
QDT000015
                                QDT
                                URI_ Identifier. Type
                                1.0
                                anyURI represents a Uniform Resource Identifier Reference (URI). An anyURI value can be absolute or relative, and may have an optional fragment identifier (i.e., it may be a URI Reference). This type should be used to specify the intention that the value fulfills the role of a URI as defined by [RFC 2396], as amended by [RFC 2732].
                                Identifier
                                URI
                                string

qdt:YearDateType.description:
QDT000002
                                QDT
                                Year_ Date. Type
                                1.0
                                gYear represents a gregorian calendar year. The ·value space· of gYear is the set of Gregorian calendar years as defined in § 5.2.1 of [ISO 8601]. Specifically, it is a set of one-year long, non-periodic instances e.g. lexical 1999 to represent the whole year 1999, independent of how many months and days this year has.
                                Date
                                Year
                                string

qdt:YearMonthDateType.description:
QDT000003
                                QDT
                                Year Month_ Date. Type
                                1.0
                                gYearMonth represents a specific gregorian month in a specific gregorian year. The ·value space·of gYearMonth is the set of Gregorian calendar months as defined in § 5.2.1 of [ISO 8601]. Specifically, it is a set of one-month long, non-periodic instances e.g. 1999-10 to represent the whole month of 1999-10, independent of how many days this month has.
                                Date
                                Year Month
                                string
